string.text: You know stalker, you can get botulism or an intestinal virus from bad corned beef. And certainly liver toxicity and cholesterol from vodka. It's best to try any food on dogs first.
A mature bloodsucker teaches a young one. "You must attack stalkers in such a way that they have time to see you and react." "Why so?" "Cause they're much tastier when there's no more shit in 'em!"

A wonderful picture. Zone at the sunset. The orange and red sun is casting shadows around tall trees and low bushes. Clouds on the sky are soaked with colours. In between all of these, at the large fallen tree near the cave, sits gray and blue swamp bloodsucker. Out of the cave, laughing and yelling, three little bloodsuckers are coming. They immediatelly start teasing and pulling their father by the tentacles, hitting him with the claws. "Papa, papa, show us the two stalkers!" And papa pulls out two skulls from under the large fallen tree, takes them into his hands and speaks in different voices... The left skull says... "Hey, Mitya, are you sure that there are no bloodsuckers in this cave?" The right skull answers... "Absolutely none, Kolya, nobody has ever seen 'em here..."

A "Monolith" militant is walking through a wood and sees a bloodsucker. He drops to his knees and preys: "Oh, Great and Allmighty Monolith! Please, fill the soul of this creature of yours with intelligence and religiousness!" Instantly, the bloodsucker also drops to his knees and lifts up hands to heavens: "Oh, Great and Wise Monolith! Please, bless the food I'm going to partake of now!"
A stalker calls into a pet shop: "Do you have any talking parrots?" "No, but we have a woodpecker. It knows the Morse code."

"Two stalkers are sitting by a camp fire. One says: "I think that the laziest people in the Zone are the soldiers - they just hold up a rookie by the village, take his stuff, and go sell it to Sidorovich." The other cocks his head and replies: - "No, buddy, you're wrong. The laziest people in the Zone are the traders - I knew one who would always get up extra early, just so he could do nothing for a bit longer!"

So, this one day, Freedom catches a Dutier by the Military Warehouses, and begin interrogating him. - "Alright, spill it, how many people are there in your assault group!" - "I'm not telling you bastards anything! Do what you want!" - "Just think about it, we're all honest here, we'll give you a pack of weed for every man you name in your team!" - "Ha ha! Did you people really think I would sell out my entire squad for just twelve packs of weed?!"

So, once upon a time, the eggheads decided to do live testing of their new medicines. So they hired a group of stalkers. One day, one of the subjects comes up, and asks: - "Professor, did you switch my drug with something else?" The scientist leans in, fixes his spectacles, looking very intrigued: - "And what might lead you to believe that the drug was substituted with something else?" The stalker replies: - "Well, before, when I threw out the pills into the swamp, they sank out of sight, but now, all of a sudden, they're floating!"

I remember a story: Three stalkers are sharing advice, and one says: - "I bought a black leather jacket, so bandits will think I'm one of their own!" The other replies: - "Well, I re-painted my suit to look like military armour, so no one even wants to get close enough for a second look!" The third stalker says: - "I bought an old, torn-up suit, and painted on the back 'I'm cursed, touch me, and my bad luck will be yours too'. Now no one even comes within fifty metres!"

Once upon a time by the Cordon, a soldier and a stalker cross paths. The stalker asks: - "Where you going?" - "What the hell, dude? That's a military secret!" - "Oh, calm down bro, I didn't realize. Why are you so sweaty, carrying something heavy?" The soldier mutters: - "As if you wouldn't get sweaty, hauling all these armour piercing rounds to the warehouse..."
A medic is examining the injuries of his stalker patient. - "Good... Good... Good..." he murmurs. - "What's so good, doctor?" the stalker asks. - "Good that it ain't on me!"

Two Freedomers are sitting around talking. One says: - "I think, that in order to make an important decision, one has to get drunk first!" The other replies: - "Well I think, that when it comes to getting drunk, we don't even need to make an important decision."

So once upon a time, a stalker stashes his loot in a tree. Then, one evening, he decides to check if everything is still there. And sure enough - someone's sitting in the tree, his bare feet dangling down. The stalker creeps up, and grips the intruder hard between the legs: - "Alright ass hole, who are you - what faction are you from?" No response - just silence. The stalker squeezes even harder. - "I asked who the hell are you?" The intruder is still silent. The stalker becomes enraged, and squeezes so hard that blood starts running down his arm. - "Alright you bastard! Listen up! You'd better answer before I rip it all off!" And from the tree, a weak, wheezing voice replies: - "I'm... a Controller!" - "Well why the hell didn't you say that before!" - "I'm mute!"
One stalker asks another: - "Do you know which car is the best for a stalker?" - "No, which one?" - "The Zaporozhets - it's got the trunk in the front, so it's easy to keep an eye on the loot!"

At the Military warehouses, the annual trip to the rifle range gets cancelled for the second year in a row, but the semi-annual physical fitness test remains still on as planned. So one soldier gets amused: "Does it bother anyone else that the military doesn't seem to care how well we can shoot, but they are extremely interested in how fast we can run?"

Some bandits are about to be hanged for their crimes. The crowd takes three of them to a tree at the edge of the river. They put the first bandit in the noose, but he's so sweaty, he slips out, falls into the river, and swims to freedom. They tie the noose around the second fellow's neck. He, too, slips out of the rope, drops into the river, and gets away. It's the third crook's turn. He looks at the mob and says, "Do me a favour... tighten that noose a bit - I can't swim."
One bandit says to another: "I have a dream. I want to rob a bank and leave my mother-in-law's fingerprints."

Chukcha writes a letter to his brother: "I'm writing this slowly because I know your reading is poor. I wanted to send some money to you, but I've already glued the envelope. I know you have a newborn, but is it a son or a daughter? What am I now, an uncle or an aunt?"

The inner perimeter of the Zone. A rookie approaches a stalker's house and knocks at the fence. Silence. He knocks again. No response. He pulls himself up a bit and sees a dog in the yard. The dog says: "Why do you keep on knocking? Don't ya see there's nobody at home?" The rookie faints for a while. Having regained his senses he opens the eyes and sees the dog standing by his side. "Hey, Doggy, can't you bark?" "I can, I just didn't want to scare you..."

A military officer is interrogating a stalker. - Do you admit that while drunk you tried to sneak out of the Zone, in the area of military checkpoint 12, carrying unregistered firearms and items forbidden for export out of the Zone? The stalker is getting tired, he's been interrogated like this for 3 hours so... Yes I admit it. I was DRUNK. If I was sober I'd never try to pass so close to you bastards.

Two stalkers are sitting by the lake and one says: - You know what they say about radiation? It's lies, all lies. I've been here for ages and no problems. And the other says: - Yeah, exactly... although for some reason my tail is shedding.

Mercenaries caught a Stalker, brought him to the well, dropped him head first in it, held him for a minute, then pulled him out and asked: - Got any artifacts or money? - Nope. Again they dropped him in and pulled him out. - Artifacts? Money? - Nope. Again they dipped him... Artifacts? Money? The stalkers patience's was running out: "Look guys, either dip me in further or hold me down longer. The water's murky, how the heck am I supposed to find anything?"

A drunk stalker takes a leak by a lamp post in the street at the Bar. A Dutier tries to reason with him: "Can't you see the latrine is just 10 meters away?" The drunk replies: "Do you think I got me a damn fire hose in my pants here?"

A stalker is walking past a swamp in the Garbage and suddenly sees - a common frog sitting on a mound. He gets bewildered at first, then begins to look for signs of mutation, well if it has an extra leg or an eye on its ass, but no, everything is fine. He racks his brain and then gets ready to go. Then suddenly the frog says: "Kiss me, Prince Ivan, and I'll be your wife!" The stalker just falls into the swamp. He begins to slowly crawl away from the frog, when the frog speaks again: "Well, kiss me, I'll be beautiful, and we'll live happily ever after!" Well, the stalker again racks his brain and thinks - here goes nothing, anything can happen in the Zone, even a snork can turn out a beauty. Well, he picks up and kisses the frog; but the frog turns into a bloodsucker. "Thank you, my good fellow, and now as we agreed - I will be your wife, there's no escape! And never ever dare say, that I'm not a beauty!"

A stalker finds an old bottle, picks it up and opens it. A genie comes out of the bottle and says: "Thanks so much for letting me out! I feel I should do something for you, too. Would you like to become a Hero of the Soviet Union?" The guy says: "Yes, sure!" Next thing he knows, he finds himself on a battlefield with five grenades, alone against five Panzer's.

One morning, a blind dog came in front of a pack of rodents. "Is there a brave one among you, guys?!" Complete silence. "Then, if there's none, each one of you must bring me an artirfact by tomorrow." The next morning the blind dog came again, and so did it the day after. In the third evening, the rodents held a meeting. "Let's call a pseudodog to assist us!" So they did. On the fourth day, even before the blind dog could say anything, the pseudodog appeared. "I am the brave one here", it said loudly. Then, from the bushes and trees behind the blind dog a Controller appeared: "If you are the only brave one here, you will bring me ten artifacts by tommorow. The rest of you, the non-brave ones, just one each."

Three old residents of the Zone start chatting: "Eh, I remember, just after the explosion apples kept growing so big... I took one home, placed it on a chair, and the chair collapsed!" "Don't ya say! I harvested once an apple, put it on my table - the table collapsed!" "That's all nuts! Once I was driving a cart and saw a really big apple. I harvested it, put it in the cart..." The other two, simultaneously: "The cart collapsed?" "No. A worm came out and swallowed my horse."

Lieutenant Rzhevskij heard that the tail of a pseudo dog would increase his "virility" if he tied it to his member. He got a tail, tied it on and went to the ball. He returned all confused. One of his Ensigns then asks: What is it, Lieutenant?" "Well, imagine this, I went to the ball, and coming to welcome me was Natasha, but in the hands she was holding her lap-dog. Then the tail I tied inside my pants started to wag! Then wham - Natasha fainted!" "Yes, such a bummer sir... " "Well don't tell anyone, but the lap dog wasn't bad!.. Ensign, Ensign - don't puke!"

A military drill sergeant had just chewed out one of his cadets, and as he was walking away, he turned to the cadet and said, "I guess when I die you'll come and dance on my grave." The cadet replied, "Not me, Sarge... no sir! I promised myself that when I got out of the Army I'd never stand in another line!"

At the Freedom Barracks, the commander calls the captain: "Take as many soldiers as you need and start building additional toilets. The number of the people in need has increased!" "I would suggest, sir, instead of building more toilets, maybe we should hire a new cook!"

A stalker sits near the fire in an abandoned tunnel, his backpack stuffed full of loot. Outside, there's a thunderstorm with radioactive rain and howling wind... Suddenly, a pseudo giant appears at the entrance to the tunnel and timidly asks if it can come inside and warm up. The stalker, cocks the bolt on his gun and says: - "Get out of here!" The pseudo giant runs. An hour later, it comes back - shivering, begging to come inside. The stalker throws a grenade towards it, and it runs away again. An hour later, it returns again, soaked to the skin, frozen, battered from anomalies and glowing from radiation, asking to get warm. Out of pity, the stalker lets it come inside. The giant quickly runs to the farthest corner, hides, and mutters under its breath: "Go away, go away... Isn't this my place?"

A veteran stalker got tired of rambling all over the Zone. So he decided to settle down in some abandoned house and make his living by farming. Once a rookie stalker comes to visit him and asks: "Haven't seen you in the Zone for a long time. Where have you been?" "I'm not going into the Zone ever again, I've got sick and tired of it. I'm satisfied with living here, farming and all... Come, take a look at my garden." The rookie takes a walk about the garden and gets excited! "So big watermelons! Never saw anything like that! And the vegetable marrows are just wonderful! So nice here! And the nightingale sings so nicely! You've got an excellent garden!" The veteran sighs and says: "Just a garden, nothing special: those are not watermelons but gooseberries, not marrows but pea pods... And it's not a nightingale but a Geiger counter..."

A stalker is returning back home after a deep raid. Pale face, staggering gait... Something is obviously wrong. His friends see him and rush rush to meet him, hand him medkits, vodka and all. "Vasya, what's wrong with you?" "Mmm..." "Milk? Want some milk?" "Mmmmm...." "Monolithians? "Monolith" fanatics have wounded you?!" "Mmmmmmm..... MMMMURDER YOU!!!!!!!!!!!"

A soldier gets lost in the Zone for a few days. His uniform is ripped and dirty, he's as hungry as hell, running out of ammo... basically he's getting desperate. Then, hey, he spots a couple of Stalkers on the horizon. He runs up to them: "Friends, comrades, brothers... Please help me!" The stalkers say: "That's interesting. At the check point at the Cordon it's all "Bastards" and "animals", and now it’s all "friends" and "brothers", yeah?"

Two rookies once had to stay over night in the Zone. So, they set up a fire by some tree and got ready to go to bed... Suddenly, they heard some rustle from the bushes! And a bloodsucker sprang out of there and rushed towards one of ðåó stalkers! The stalker started climbing the tree but the bloodsucker managed to get hold of his foot... The stalker shouted to his fellow: "Shoot him! Shoot!" The latter immediately grabbed his rifle, aimed and shot off the bloodsucker's left grain! But the bloodsucker just groaned and still kept holding its victim. "Shoot him!!! Shoot him down, man!!!" The stalker aimed again and shot off the bloodsucker's right grain... The stalker from the tree sees the situation and shouts again: "Look, man, shoot him IN THE HEAD! I'm quite certain the monster is not at all going to fuck me!"
Two pseudo-fleas are talking on a pseudo-dog. One asks the other: "Do you think that other pseudo-fleas have pseudo dogs too?"

Some tourist is bumming around the Zone, chewing a bubble gum, admiring the scenery, listening to nice music in his iPod and all... Suddenly he stumbles upon some tall guy wearing old blue jeans. The guy asks: "Who are you?" "Eh, me? I... I am a tourist." "Nope. I AM a tourist. And you must be the "Tourist's delight"..."

One mobster asks another one: "Vovan, why did ya give up studies on how to play the guitar?" The other one answers: "You know, the guitar has got 6 strings, and I've got only 5 fingures." "Aha... What kind of mutants play the piano then, I wonder?!"

Head of the military intelligence is making a report in the Ministry of Defense: "It has been known that there are numerous bandits and smugglers within the Zone territory. They are mostly in smuggling artifacts from the Zone and weapons into it. Besides, many criminals are escaping from justice to be administered. To put an end to that we have been injecting our agents under cover into the Zone." "Have you achieved any success?" "Indeed, we have! Presently, there are 5 gangs in the Zone, which consist entirely of our agents!"

A stalker got to the Sarcophagus. He explores the interior and finally gets to the room, in which the legendary Monolith stands. And there he sees it: a huge, black phallus! The phallus addresses to the stalker in a human voice: "Thou way is at an end, human! Come closer!" The stalker approaches slowly: "Ah, well... What... or who are you? the "Monolith"?" "No, not at all." "But who then?!" "Look, man, have you ever been told to go and fuck yourself?" "Yes..." "So, you have come exactly there!"

How stalkers decorate a Christmas tree: they dress up the fir tree with toys, garlands, tinsel, and then enriched uranium or radium. In principle, the garlands aren't necessary, since the enrichment of radioactive elements gives out a glow at night. Instead of a star, they use one of their artifacts.

An old stalker is being questioned by a journalist at the army outpost. "People say, you carry assault rifles, hand grenades... is it true?!" "Well, people nowadays say a lot of things." "People say, you even have machine guns, rocket launchers... " "Well, people nowadays say a lot of things." "People say, you have all kinds of... girls, at your bar, well, you know... "Uhm... oh my... oh my... what we don't have, we don't have."

Once upon a time two robbers are sitting by the fire, a veteran and a rookie. The veteran keeps smoking a pot. The rookie asks him: "They say you have seen a pseudodog two meters high with two heads and enormous balls... Is that true???" The veteran holds him the pot: "Inhale it and hold your breath. You may see something even more mysterious yourself!"

A stalker comes to see Swamp Doctor. "Help me, Doctor, I cannot help scratching myself!" Doctor examines the guy. "Did you try taking a shower?" "I did. But the problem comes back again after a month..."
The bloodsucker sees some stalker in an exoskeleton and says with a sigh: "Dammit, canned food again..."

A Dutier and a Freedomer are sentenced to Hell. The Devil summons them and says: "Guys, you have 2 options: an Duty or Freedom hell. In the Duty one you can do what you want, but you'll have to eat a bucket of shit every morning. The Freedom one is the same, but it's 2 buckets." The Dutier quickly makes up his mind and goes to Duty Hell, while the Freedomer eventually chooses the Freedom one. In a week or so they meet. The Freedomer asks: "So, what's it like out there?" "Exactly what the devil said, the Hell itself is OK, but eating a bucket of shit is killing me. And you?" "Ah, it feels just like home - either the shit doesn't get delivered or there aren't enough buckets for everyone!"

A veteran stalker and a rookie were going camping. They pitched their tent under the stars and went to sleep. Sometime in the middle of the night the veteran woke the rookie up and said: "Look up at the stars, and tell me what you see." The rookie replied: "I see millions and millions of stars." The veteran said: "And what do you deduce from that?" The rookie replied: "Well, if I see millions of stars, that means that the weather is clear and is likely to stay clear tomorrow, so it's also unlikely that there will happen a Surge. Right?" And the veteran said: "You idiot, it means that somebody stole our tent."

The Bartender hired some stalkers - to build a cheap tavern for him. He negotiated with a local burer, who rummaged through the Garbage collecting pipes, fittings, and boards that weren't completely rotten, and soaked them in "jelly" for durability. All these were connected with bolts from the wrecked helicopters, and instead of advertising, he painted an APC bright pink. He decided to call the tavern "Witches' Jelly". Inside in the order of rank - waitresses with tentacles, snorks in gas masks doing a pole dance striptease, MoozE on stage playing the guitar and balalaika and artifacts hanging from the ceiling shimmering in different colours. But something was missing. The stalkers didn't order vodka so the new place wasn't making a profit. The next day the bartender had an idea. Finally he realized what was happening. So he put an aquarium in the centre full of "Goldfish". As a sort of decoration. Then the profits flooded in!

After being defeated in their last campaign, a Duty soldier and his commander come into the Bar, tired as dogs and all covered in blood, and of course, they order a couple of beers. In the course of the night the commander tells how he killed a controller, cut up a zombie and beat off bloodsuckers... Then a mosquito flies into the room. Both Duty guys start firing at it at the same time. The bartender yells from under the counter: "Hey, what are you doing?" The Duty Commander replies: "These small reptiles should be killed, before they become adult bloodsuckers".

During training exercises, the lieutenant who was driving down a muddy back road encountered another UAZ stuck in the mud with a red-faced Colonel at the wheel. "Is your UAZ stuck, comrade Colonel?" asked the lieutenant as he pulled alongside. "Nope," replied the colonel, coming over and handing him the keys, "Yours is."

A horde of fleshes keeps running in circles. Suddenly the leader stops and says: "So, brethren... Have we made GREAT noise?" "Yes, we have!" "Have we raised TONNES of dust in the air?" "Yes, yes, we have!!!" "We are almost like HORSES, then!"

An old woman stands in the market with a "Chernobyl mushrooms for sale" sign. A man goes up to her and asks, "Hey, what are you doing? Who's going to buy Chernobyl mushrooms?" And she tells him, "Why, lots of people. Some for their boss, others for their mother-in-law..."

>"Hello, stalkers! You are probably going to the "Monolith" for fulfilment of your wishes?" "That's right! You are reading our thoughts!" "Nice! "Our thoughts"... Are you sure they are actually YOURS?" - the controller asked venomously...

Two loners and a dutyer died and went to Heaven. So Apostle Peter tells them: "You have performed good deeds and lived a life of righteousness. So, what would you want people to say about you at your funerals?" First stalker: "I want to be always remembered to have been a good fellow who had always helped others in need, sharing the last medkit with a companion." "So be it. What about you?" - St. Peter asks the dutyer. "And I want people to say that I was an irreconcilable and glorious fighter against mutants and the Zone." "Thou will has been fulfilled. So, what would you want?" - Peter asks the remaining stalker. "I want people at my funeral to say: "Look! He's alive!!!"

A TV crew comes to the Zone to shoot their film about it. So they catch up to one of our guys and ask him: - "What do you think of the army - of the enlisted men?" - "Assholes, all of them, assholes! They're only good for skinning us stalkers. They're afraid of the mutants too. In short - they don't do shit! They're all just assholes!" The TV crew pause for a moment, stunned, taking it in, before speaking up again: - "What a radiant display of honesty... This outburst leads us to wonder... What do you think of the 'Duty' faction?" The Freedomer is silent for a moment, taking the time to think about it for several seconds. - "You know guys, I think I really overdid it about the army folks. They're alright guys, really!"

Sidorovich made an offer to a rookie stalker. "Listen, sonny, I was given a new suit from the Kiev Research Institute. They wanted me to test it. They claim that it protects fully from radiation, 100%. But I am an old man, sitting here all day. Why don't you take it, test it for several days, and then come back with your results. I can give you a discount on this one, let's say, half price." The rookie takes the suit and goes outside. Several days pass. One morning, the rookie enters Sidorovich's bunker, angry as an snork, throwing the suit on the table in front of the trader. Sidorovich looks at him with surprise. "So?! What is it now?" "I don't want this crap!" "But why? Does it protect?" "Yes, you bet it does." "Completely?! 100%" "Yes, 100%." "So what then?" "The whole Zone is fighting radiation disease with vodka, but I'm the only poor fool staying sober for 4 days!".

An experienced stalker is standing at a crossroads, looking at a sign: "If you go right, there will be anomalies and a little loot". "If you go forward, there will be lots of monsters and medium loot". "If you go left, there will be inns, women, and endless loot!" The stalker thinks for a while, and walks forward thinking to himself, "I've heard about this before, but I should ask at the Bar, what the hell are "inns and women"?

A stalker says to another one: "You smell like shit! Why?" "Well, you see... Kolya and I were tracking down a controller. Kolya somehow lagged behind and I discovered the controller's den, put on the psi-helmet and started crouching in... Suddenly I felt a hand on my shoulder!.. I turned around and, actually, realized it was Kolya... But couldn't help shitting anyway..."

A veteran and a rookie Dutier are walking through the Zone. Suddenly, the old one stops and whispers to the new one: "Carefully, go to that tree." The rookie slowly, very slowly, walks over to the tree. When he reaches it, the veteran shouts: "I knew it! I knew they were kidding me when they said there was an anomaly there!"

Having just moved into his new office, a pompous new colonel was sitting at his desk when a corporal knocked on the door. Conscious of his new position, the colonel quickly picked up the phone, told the corporal to enter, then said into the phone, "Yes, General, I'll be seeing him this afternoon and I'll pass along your message. In the meantime, thank you for your good wishes, sir." Feeling as though he had sufficiently impressed the young enlisted man, he asked, "What do you want?" "Nothing important, sir," the corporal replied, "I'm just here to hook up your telephone."
A Freedomer hears the doorbell and opens the door, he sees a rabbit, an elephant and a panda bear: Sir, we are investigating a complaint that there is psychogenic substance abuse in this house.

A Duty commander asks a stalker: "Hey son, do you want to join us?" "Why not, but only as a general." he replies. The commander starts yelling at the stalker "Are you an idiot?" "Is that a requirement?" he asks.

Two soldiers are at the outpost. "Well, at the boot camp we had a very stupid sergeant. One evening, a bunch of us went to have fun with him... "Comrade Sergeant, which is heavier? A kilo of cotton, or a kilo of iron?" "A kilo of iron." the sergeant said immediately. We all laughed. "No, no, comrade sergeant, it is all the same." "Is it? Stand right here, and I will knock you in the head with kilo of cotton, and then with a kilo of iron, and you will clearly see the difference!"

A general noticed one of his soldiers behaving oddly. The soldier would pick up any piece of paper he found, frown and say, "That's not it" and put it down again. This went on for some time, until the general arranged to have the soldier psychologically tested. The psychologist concluded that the soldier was deranged, and wrote out his discharge from the army. The soldier picked it up, smiled and said, "That's it."

So, hear this: One day, a general comes down from the command to visit the Cordon outpost. He walks over to one of the guards and asks: - "So, soldier, how's your duty?" - "Oh, it's alright, sir, I'm getting used to it!" - "Just imagine, soldier - you're now defending people from the Zone itself. How did you end up here? Did you volunteer?" - "Well of course, sir, I agree that people should be protected from the Zone!" The general smiles. - "What a good soldier!", he says as the soldier goes on. - "Yeah, I told the same thing to the conscripting officer at the recruitment centre - but that bitch didn't listen!".

One morning after a heavy night's drinking a Freedom officer woke up and noticed his orderly cleaning his tunic. "Oh, Vanya," said the officer, "I did get pissed last night! There was one real pig there who was sick all over my tunic." "You're absolutely right," said the orderly, "he must have been a real pig, because he dumped in your pants as well."

Three stalkers made a bet, who will be able to scare the largest number of people from inside the 100 Rads bar, by any means possible. The first day, the first stalker entered the 100 Rads bar swinging his PKM machine gun loaded with a 150 rounds belt of 7.62x54mm, and shouting out loud: "everyone out, fast!" Some of the rookies did run out, but the remaining stalkers quickly and easily disarmed him and taught him a good lesson. The second day, the second stalker found a dried and preserved bloodsucker's head somewhere, stuck his own head into it, dressed off bare naked and roaring like a madman, ran into the 100 Rads bar. Most of the stalkers ran out the door, but a few remaining veterans and a Duty squad pulled off the bloodsucker's head from him, and taught him a good lesson. The third day, the third stalker entered the 100 Rads bar in his old and worn suit, and with an almost broken AKSU on his shoulder. He ordered a drink, took a sip and started coughing... "A... arg... a... cough... cou... aarg... uuh. Damned tuberculosis."

Duty and Freedom are fighting at the Army Warehouses. Rifles and shotguns blazing from everywhere. One can hear, loud and clear, the Freedom fighters shouting: "Freedom fighters! Stand up! Attack!" Near an old Duty veteran, a newbie in his shiny suit, out-of-the-box Abakan assault rifle, and with his face in the dirt, says. "Is it time to retreat yet? Are they coming?" "No." Says the veteran calmly and fires a couple of shots from his rusty RPK. Freedomers quickly throws themselves on the ground. After a few moments of silence, again, from the Freedom side, shouting: "Freedom fighters! Stand up! Attack!" "Now, shall we retreat? They will kill us all?!" Cries the newbie. "No." Says the veteran calmly and fires a couple of shots from his rusty RPK. Freedomers quickly throws themselves on the ground. After a longer silence, the leader of the Freedom squad stands up, all covered with dust and mud. "So, what is it now, you bastards, was it your turn to retreat now or not?" The veteran pulls out the feeding belt from his rusty RPK, and says calmly to the newbie. "Now, it is time to retreat."

A pseudogiant and a flesh are heading through the Zone. They walk slowly and seem to be overwhelmed by grief... Suddenly the Pseudogiant stops, turns his face to the Flesh and says sadly: "I told you, Piglet! Those were wrong bees and they made wrong honey! Normal honey never glows in the dark..."

It is said there is some Black Stalker in the Zone. At night he comes to the tents of Stalkers, reaches his black hand inside and begs in hoarse voice: - WATER, PLEASE... NEED DRINK... And if you don't give him a bit from the flask or if you try to leave the tent... he'll kill you. So one time a Stalker decides to play a practical joke on his mates. He puts on black leather gloves, sneaks up to the nearest tent, thrusts his hand inside and starts: - Water, please... water. Suddenly a black hand appears from inside the tent, grabs him by the throat and a hoarse voice says: - WHAT DO YOU WANT WITH MY WATER?

A rookie Stalker is returning from a raid. Then... oops.. a lake is in the way, it shouldn't be here according to his map. Nothing to do but to go around... Then he spots another guy, who looks older and experienced, doesn't look like a bandit or a mercenary. So the rookie approaches the man, starts asking about the lake and what to do. The guy listens, learns where the rookie's heading and says: "I am heading that way myself, let's go, I'll guide you." So as they are circling the lake, everything's fine, the rookie feels much better, he starts chatting away: "It must be great to be an experienced Stalker, not be spooked by every noise, not be afraid of every shadow, you don't even carry a weapon." The older guy starts laughing: - "Oh come on, what's here to be afraid of?" - "What do you mean?" says the rookie, "Monsters, mutants... And controllers alone are enough to scare the life out of you." His companion falls silent and then says: "You are an idiot, you know that? If you'd said zombies or bloodsuckers - fine. But why did you have to go and insult us, controllers?"

A stalker got lost in the Red Forest. He shouts: "Can anybody hear me?!" At this moment a shadow moves behind him and something touches him on the shoulder. The stalker, filled with fear, slowly turns around and before him stands a bloodsucker. "Why are you shouting?" The Stalker, trying to explain his predicament, responds: "Well, I got lost, maybe somebody can hear me shouting and come to my aid!" The bloodsucker scratches his belly and smiles: "Well, I heard you, does that make you feel better?

Some Duty stalkers assemble at a rendezvous point, and one of them is late... really late... People are starting to get worried that something has happened to him. Then he shows up and naturally everyone wants to know what the hell kept him. - "Well you see, this morning I decided to exterminate a few mutants. So I went into the Zone, killed 5 controllers, two dozen bloodsuckers, few hundred zombies and snorks, I didn't even count how many dogs and boars…" - "Well, so what?" asked his team mates. - "Well, then I went back to the camp, you know, my place in the basement of the old house. When going down the stairs I saw a big mean bastard of a zombie. He looked too tough even for me..." - "Well?" - "You see, I forgot I have a mirror hanging by the door... After that I had to clean up, change my pants, that sort of thing..."

Two stalkers have met in the Zone, near the Red Forest. "How are you?" "Hi! I'm fine." "Look, why have you got this strange nickname: "One Dick"?" "Ok, listen. I was born here before the 1st Catastrophe broke out. After that disaster took place, I remained here. So did I after the 2nd Catastrophe as well. And the environment here is not pretty good in the ecological aspect, you know. You must have noticed that I've got 4 arms, 3 legs, 30 fingures, 3 ears... Guess now, what question they use to ask me MOST FREQUENTLY?.."

A controller is trying to teach a blind dog to do tricks. It's not really working as planned. Doggie's resisting. And nearby a zombie's standing, smirking... and says: "Neh, might as well quit, doggie's not learning." The controller glances at the zombie and says: "Ah, quiet you. Remember, Stalker, it took you a while too before you learned to bring me my slippers."

A stalker goes to see a guy. - "Doctor, I can't sleep. I have nightmares whenever I close my eyes. I always dream I am inside the reactor and monsters are ripping me to bits." - "Eh, dear… that's just a controller trying to affect you. But don't worry, just drop by after your raids, and for a small payment, like a bottle of Vodka, we'll have you fixed up in no time." - "Well, that's a relief. Thank you so much doctor." says the stalker - "No, no. Thank YOU. It so nice to see someone showing some proper respect. It's the first time anyone called a controller – Doctor."

It's not the colour of our outfits that separate us from simpletons. The Zone is not a tavern with wenches and nor a branch of kindergarten ¹4. Even if you're wearing the best body armour and armed with the coolest of guns and "Bubble" artifacts, if your hands are growing out of your ass and your head is full of God knows what shit, you will not survive, you will die at the first opportunity. Therefore, pay attention, attention, and once again, pay attention, you don't want to end up like Victor Nosaty. I told this idiot: "Don't go, don't try to be a hero!" The idiot wouldn't listen. We never found his body, all we had was the message on our PDAs." 'A stalker has been lost, Victor Nosaty, the cause of death is unknown...'
Help me to get in contact with lads from the Dark Valley.
All right. Since you helped me, I'll help you. It will cost you 1000 roubles. I'll send a word and none of Borov's guys will touch you for a day.
Good. Take the money.
I changed my mind.
Sidorovich, I want to put an end to gang life and restore my relations with Loners.
Well, it can be settled. Pay 40,000 roubles and I believe that gang life will be over.
Okay, I agree.
No, I changed my mind.
I have problems with Loners. Could you give me a hand to reconcile relations?
It's not hard to do. Especially since you didn't upset the Loners too much. I'll help you for 10,000 roubles.
I'm aware that you have enemies at the Cordon. Your problem will be solved for 20,000 roubles - and you can sleep well. He-he-he.
Yes, you have a problem there. Loners from the Bar are eager to tear you to pieces. Well, pay me 30,000 roubles, and I'll somehow settle your problem.
Yes, you pissed off Loners. It's caused me a lot of problems. Well, for 40,000 roubles I'll try to rectify this situation.
You've stirred up a hornet's nest. It won't be easy to set things right. You'd better not go to the bar... Umm... Fork out 50,000 roubles.
Well, you're just a walking killing machine. Do you think this will be easy to settle? This will cost you 60,000 roubles.
I agree, especially since it's not a huge amount.
Good. Life in the area should be calm now.
Agreed. Lads at the Bar shouldn't be annoyed with you now.
Agreed. Hopefully you won't have any more problems at the Bar?
Agreed. Less battles - less problems.
Piss off, you old bastard. I'll do without your mediation.
The Wild Territory. A bush. A hole. Well, I'll try to find it. Thank you.
Don't forget about the hidden weapon. You can find the AS Val with ammo in the Wild territory. A passage near a bush.
Thanks, I won't forget.
Is there anything you wanted to ask?
Not yet. It's hard to get nowadays.
Well? You didn't forget my request? You brought a bottle?
Here, I got you a drink. Take it.

Thank you. You rescued me with a medkit and now you've helped me out again. I have a stash in the Wild Territory. I was there one day after an emission, seeing what had changed in the area when I spotted this path. You have to go behind a bush, and then along the track to the gate to a workshop. There, near a hole in the gate I stashed a gorgeous silent weapon - a customized AS Val with ammo for it. If you go there, you can have it. Only, be careful when you come back, it would be very unfortunate if you lost it.
Why are you so upset? Tell me, what's the matter?
Listen, Marked One. I have serious withdrawal symptoms. Help me out.
What do you need?

I want to move away after this experience. Get me a bottle of vodka. I'll tell you a secret. Don't laugh, I know the whereabouts of chic weapon in return. If you help me out, I'll tell you where it is. Well, what do you say?
Why not? I'll do it.
No, I don't feel like searching for vodka.
This area is off limits, stalker.
I need to pass.
It's prohibited!\nBut if you really want to... you can! Let's say, for 1500 roubles.
Take the money. Damn extortionist!
Now listen up. We'll pretend for a moment it's nothing but mosquitoes and butterflies around here. What happens beyond this point is your own damn business.
Alright, keep moving! Get your ass out of here, before we change our mind.
I don't have that kind of money.
Then go back where you came from and get it. And don't you try and sneak past us, you hear? Trust me, it's not worth dying for.
Get out of here, Marked One. Walk away or crawl away, the choice is yours.
What's got into you?
Hi there! What do you need?
Our boss here wanted to see you. But that doesn't make you a welcome guest. Keep moving.
Hello stalker. I'm Guide. And what is your name?
They call me Marked One. And you're Guide? Then you're the one I've been looking for.
What is it that you need?
Guide, I need to meet with Doctor.
Why do you need to meet with him? And what do you expect, that I dump whatever I'm busys with and take you to a secret location?!
Ghost sent me. He asked that you arrange for a "certain person" to meet with Doctor. I am that person. I'm trying to find Strelok.
Well, you should've told that straight away! Good. Doctor is in Strelok's hiding place. If you are who you say you are, you probably know where it is.
That was a pleasant conversation. Thank you, I'll go see Doctor.
What do you need from me?
Could you tell me more about this place?

This is the road to the Zone. If I were you, I wouldn't get too close to the army outpost or let those soldiers see you; they've got orders to shoot on sight. Further up North there's a broken bridge, but they've set up an outpost there too. Open areas are crawling with wild dogs, so it's not a safe place for rookies. Oh, and a pack of mutants shows up every now and then.
What about the soldiers at the bridge? I've got to get past them somehow.

Alright, you've got two options. If Kuznetsov is on duty, keep in mind that he is quite fond of money. Good chance he'll let you through for a bribe. But if you're low on cash or if it's someone else's shift, there is a different way. Go on the left side of the bridge, along the railway. Just make sure they don't see you! You'll come across a small tunnel that goes through the embankment. And another thing: you might also land a date with some zombies down there.
What's further up North beyond the army outpost?
The Garbage, that's what. Now that's a depressing place. So much contaminated shit in some spots that swimming would be easier than walking.
Hello. Wolf has already sent word of you. You got any questions?
Yes. How many bandits are there in the camp?

Seven or eight of them. Two by the gate, two more in the building to the right near the fire, and another two in the one to the left - that's where they're keeping Nimble. Someone usually hangs around the yard as well. That's about it. Shall we say a prayer and go?
Let's go. Round up your men.
No. We'd make too much noise. I'll go on my own.
%c[100,50,250,50]Can we solve this matter in a different way?%c[default]
Can we solve this matter in a different way?
Well, we thought at first we'd trick them... Then we changed our mind.
What do you mean?
The idea was to disguise one of us as one of their flock. For example, as a messenger from their boss.
Why not? I'll try it.
Be warned: if this idea fails they will tear you to pieces and feed you to mutants.
It's risky one way or another. So, what's the next move?

First we have to dress you up like one of them, and then we forge a "transfer order" to give to the guy calling the shots here. This should convince him to release the prisoner into your custody and then both of you leave. It's that simple.
Do you have appropriate clothes?
We have one of their coats, but the note... that's the tricky part. Well, none of my friends spent any time in prison, so we don't have the expertise to forge it.
So you don't know anyone like that?
Nope, none at the Cordon. And there's no time to look for someone. We'll have to compose it ourselves.
Let's do it.

So, here I have a piece of paper, slightly torn, but still better than nothing... Where's my pencil? So... In short, these thugs need to believe that this "transfer order" is from someone in authority! Here we go: "Hello, you wankers! Hey you! Yes, you! If you don't.."
Isn't that way over the top?

No, they're bandits, they always try to seem tough. So, then we write: "... release the captive to this guy without delay, or I will personally tear out your eyes and throat, you reptiles. - Borov." What do you think?
Might work, I guess...
Well, less words, more action. Here's your coat, and your "transfer order". Good luck, Marked One, may the Zone be with you.
Thank you.
We went hunting and hunt we did... I think Wolf will be pleased.
There's more of 'em! Find the bastards and take them down!..
Whoa, man! Now that was something! You wiped them out and left nothing for us. I'd never believe it if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes! That blew me away, man...
Oh, come on... I was just lucky.
So, where are the piles of enemies you killed? You talk the talk, but you don't walk the walk. Get lost!
Sorry, brother, but could you go somewhere else? I'm here to meet someone...
While you're standing around waiting, I've got a couple of questions.
Okay, ask away.
Fox, tell me, where have you been in the Zone? What did you see?

That's all you want to know? Take a week off and then come back to see me. Look, my time isn't cheap and I'm kind of busy right now. Here are the basics and then you're on your own. About three kilometres North of here, you'll find the Garbage. That's the place they used to dump all the radioactive waste from the station. High radiation levels, anomalies all over the place, so there are loads of artifacts to be found there... but not very valuable. Just beware of the gangs and don't cross the Duty patrols. West of the Garbage is the former Agroprom Research Institute. Little in terms of artifacts there so you can skip it. And to the East, there's the Dark Valley. Who knows... That's a pretty weird place. It seems quiet enough, apart from a bunch of gangsters roaming around. But I got a feeling there's more to it than meets the eye. Oh, and there's the Rostok factory right beyond the Garbage. That's stalker territory. You'll find lots of clued-up folks there, they'll tell you the rest.
I've changed my mind. Thanks.
Thanks. Okay, now I'm listening very careful.
The trader told me you might know something about Strelok.

Why is everyone taking such a keen interest in him lately? Okay, I can't say I know him personally. We did "communicate" though: my guys took some shots at him once. No one got hurt - it was clear his party had been waiting for someone else, so we parted in peace. Cussed each other out across a ravine and went on our separate ways. Seriy, my brother, is now in the hangar at the Garbage - I'll dish you his coordinates so you two can have a chat. He knows more about Strelok. Be careful at the exit, a small gang has settled down in those parts. By the way, I got a few monsters chasing me and it doesn't look like they've given up yet. You mind helping me deal with them? It's a walk in the park really...
Thanks for the info, I appreciate it.
A medkit! Give me a medkit!
Here you are.
I don't have one. Sorry.
Hey man, you saved me twice, and that's not something I forget. Take this... that's all I got!
Thank you.
Our boss here wanted to see you. But that doesn't make you a welcomed guest. Keep moving.
Wait, Marked One! No one at the camp is going to talk to you right now.
Why not?
What kind of idiot would chat with a former passenger of the "death truck"? First, you have to prove you're okay to deal with.
What "death truck?" What are you talking about?

Ah, hell only knows what it really is. But whatever it is, it's bad, about as bad as it gets... Why am I talking to you about this anyway! Maybe I'm just superstitious, but you, Marked One, should really take a hike before something happens to you.
What can I do to make people trust me?
Pass the Trader's test while we watch. If you're alright - if you're not trigger-happy and you use your head, then we'll definitely find some common ground. Don't you worry.
Alright, so be it.
Hello, Marked One. What do you want?
Listen up, Marked One, you will come in handy! We could really use some help..
Go on.

I'm Fanatic, and I'm filling in as leader since Wolf left. A few mercenaries came by here yesterday... and they were some tough bastards, let me tell you. So, they came here and made a serious demand. They gave us one day to clear this camp out as they wanted to set up their own base here. They're coming back tonight, and as you can imagine, they won't be in the mood for a chat...
So, what are you going to do?

We're going to set up an ambush because a direct attack would probably be the end of us. They've got the fighting gear and everything, plus they're trained in tactics. And all we've got here are little boys. So, we've decided to just sit tight in these houses and make it look like we're gone. Then when the right moment comes, we'll attack. Fighters like you are just the thing we could use right now. And we'd make sure to thank you properly after it's all over. You know we're good for it! So, what do you say, will you help us out?
I will.

Let's spend the rest of the time preparing for the fight. Here's the plan: I'll put the most hopeless rookies in houses and basements and tell them not to make a move, otherwise they might just slaughter our own troops. You and me and a couple of other decent shots will take the best positions to have an eye on the area around the fire. As soon as they come close to the fire, we let the bullets fly from everywhere! They'll be coming from the bridge... and I don't think we'll have to wait long. So, find yourself a hiding place with a view, then wait for my command. Take a look around, but remember that your odds aren't as good in the open. It's your call.
Well, let's begin...
Nah, I don't play these games. No offence.
That's a shame. We could really use a fighter like you. I guess we'll have to do it on our own...
Waiting for these boy scouts. I got a feeling they're just around the corner.
You're a real killer, Marked One! I wouldn't want to stand in your way. Ever!
Yeah, something like that.
Here, I hope you won't forget about us. And by the way... a million thanks for the help. We saved the young ones, Marked One.
Hey, Marked One, great to see you!
Hello to you, too.
By the way, where did Wolf go?

Oh, he got a message from a stalker who was passing by. He packed his things, grabbed a box of dynamite and went deep in the Zone. I'm still getting back in shape after the wounds I got, so I'm staying at the Cordon anyway so Wolf asked me to look after the kids.
Well, look who's here! Wolf, what winds brought you here?

Skull, an old friend of mine asked for help. He was with Duty, but things got a little out of control - he quarrelled violently with his superiors. He wants to force a resolution with the anarchists but they took away his supplies for disobeying orders and he no longer has access to the arsenal... Well, then, he asked me to help out an old friend - he urgently needed a box of dynamite. It was pretty straightforward, I managed to get it a while ago, but I had another wild goose chase for booty to do here. Well, it was urgent, so I took the box, left Fanatic to look after the boys, and moved here.
Tell me. Why the hell does he need the dynamite?

I'll fucking tell you. It seems he was going to blow up these anarchists. He's become so strange lately, he's so fucked up with hatred towards those Freedomers. I feel afraid for him. He's going to get both himself and his boys killed. They listen to him without question.
Yes, I see...
Yeah, nothing good will come out of it. I'll give you some advice, Marked One - stay away from him. You'll be better off, for sure.
Well, we'll see.
I've got some questions.
Go ahead, I'll try to help.
Thank you.
What do you know about the Zone?
I know many things. Be more specific.
What's in the centre of the Zone?

Wow that's a question alright. I've been looking for the answer for two years. I still haven't found a way to the centre. At least not one I could take and come back alive. My friends and I tried to break through a couple of times. I barely made it back alive, but my friends, well, some did, some didn't. You'll ask why. We were chasing our dreams, trying to make them come true.
Can dreams come true?

There is this nice story about a Wish Granting Machine. They say there is a place in the centre of the Zone where any desires can come true no matter how bizarre. But you know what? I know for a fact there're lots of ways to kick the bucket in the centre of the Zone, and I don't believe in the Wish Granting Machine any more. Don't take that risk for nothing, I tell you.
How did the Zone come to be?
There was an explosion in 2006. That's how it came about. I know that's not a real answer. Very few know the whole truth, if anyone does at all.
What brought you to the Zone?

I used to work at a coal mine before they closed it down. I had no money and nothing to look forward to. Then I heard some rumours about the fabulous riches hidden inside the Zone. I had some experience under my belt, so I thought "What the hell?". Can't say I've become rich, but some cash came my way, that's for sure. This is a typical story; most of us got here the same way...
What's the most dangerous thing in the Zone?

Hard to say. There are so many dangers and surprises, you just can't run into all of them. There's more than enough for one person anyway. I got one toe bitten off, my hair is falling out from the radiation, and half my leg got fried in a Scorcher... Things there are real bad. Another time I happened to come face to face with a bloodsucker - that's a meeting I'd like to forget. So, we can talk all you like, but you'll never know until you experience it on your own. The only advice I can give is beware - everywhere and always.
Have you heard about a guy called Strelok?

I seem to remember he's one of the tough ones. Never actually met the man. Well, I haven't come close to the centre in a while and all we get here is rookies. You should find someone who hangs out deep in the Zone and have a chat with him.
What do you know about the "Death Trucks"?

I know nothing and that's fine by me, thank you! Sorry, I know about your situation. Too much mysticism about it. You spend a month in these parts and you can't help but become superstitious about life. Dead people in the trunk, dead people behind the wheel... Who are they, where did they come from and why? I can only hope they didn't rise up from the grave.
Hi. Why are you here?
Hi. I need to see Nimble. Would you know where I could find him?

Nimble got a raw deal. His group was attacked by some bandits a little ways from here. All he could do was send me an SOS message. It looked like his pals went under. My guys told me these bastards are now at the old car park, the one across the road.
You don't rescue your own people from capture? Not what I would call friendly. Or is it that you're just too weak to do it?

I'd bop you one, but what's the use? It's not that simple. I got too few people, and even those I got are mostly rookies. I can't take that risk. If we lose this camp, things will get even worse for all the stalkers out there. And what about yourself? If you aren't too scared, I won't let my pride make me say "No" to a helping hand. So, will you help me deal with these thugs?
Think I could do it alone?
Nope, you stand no chance by yourself. My scouts out there are good soldiers and right now they're near those freaks. Together you can pull it off. What do you think? You got the guts?
I'll try.
Way to go! Alright, I'll give you the guys' coordinates. I'll let them know about you right now.
I got it.
You don't have the guts, I see. Get out of here! I don't want to see you again!
I got the guts, but I won't go.
Yeah, like hell you do. Fine, get lost!
So, how is it going?
Your guys and I made it okay at the car park.
Nimble has been saved.
That's awesome, man! Here, take this. That's my personal reward for you.
Jellyfish.
Slime.
We went over the car park with a fine-toothed comb. It's all clear now.
Wow! My men tell me you gave them a real beating! Here, take this money... Just a memento, not counting our huge gratitude. Plus, I got something else for you here...
Hey.
I'm working on it.
Keep me posted, will you?
There is one thing... We lost Nimble, while we dealt with the bandits.
Oh, Marked One... I thought you were a professional, and could be trusted with such a task. Well, it's over now... Here's to you, Nimble.
Thanks for nothing.
I can't waste time on idle chit-chat. Take a hike.
I got that.
Hello, Marked One. What's the occasion?
What can you tell me, stalker?
What can I tell you. There were bandits at the car park, so we did some cleaning up. That's about it.
You aren't the bragging kind, are you! Look, since you've dealt with these thugs, I can't just let you go like that...
You look so serious. Are you worried about something?

I have a small problem... Hmm... Not so long ago someone came to me and placed an order. For a box of dynamite. I wanted to refuse, but I couldn't. Well, in general, it doesn't matter why. The dynamite is hidden in a locomotive which was derailed - there is also radiation there. By the way, at this point, there's no "barbed wire" along the embankment. The task is simple - you only need to find the box and bring it to me. You don't need to do anything else. So, how about it? And... If something suddenly happens to me, take it to the Army Warehouses.
Deal. I'll try to find the dynamite.
Listen, no, I'm not ready for such a case yet.
Well, I'm waiting for the dynamite then.
That's a pity. Oh, well, I'll have to try to find someone else. If you change your mind - the offer still stands.
Thanks, brother! You did a great service! I don't even know how to thank you...
Listen, I need that flash drive you were taking to the trader. Do you have it?
Yeah, I got it... Those morons can't even do a proper search. Well, what the heck, take it! After all, you saved my life. It was well hidden, but these thugs can't frisk for shit.
Thanks. Where did you keep it anyway? Who knows, might come in handy.

I didn't keep it down there so don't worry. I've worked for a trader for a long time so I can store information safely. By the way I told the thugs a nice little story about a cache full of artifacts and they ordered one guy to go there. The cache exists, but it's only got one artifact. I can give you its coordinates if you want.
Have a safe trip, stalker!
Sure, thanks.
But don't forget: there're lots of wild animals there. Besides, the gangster they sent is armed with more than a scoop and a shovel, so be careful. Thanks, man.
And thank you.
Sure, no problem. Good luck!
Mission complete. Here's the box from the army outpost.

Good! You were a great help. But, of course a "thank you" won't buy you a piece of bread. Here's twenty... wait, fifteen thousand and we're square! By the way, the soldiers will certainly notice it missing, so things are going to heat up. You better get going, and the faster, the better.
Got any special missions for me?
Nope, nothing at the moment.
What special missions? You haven't even finished with the last one yet!

Well, here's the deal... A box containing the reports made by an expedition that went deep North into the Zone has been taken to the army outpost. By day, it's guarded as if it was filled with pure plutonium, but for some reason at night, they only leave two guards.
Go on.
Sneak into the outpost quietly and "recover" the box. Do that and I'll pay you anything...within reason. Will you do it?
I'll try.
I'll get the cash ready - you haven't let me down once. Just one other thing... keep it low profile. If the military gets pissed off we're all in for a lot of trouble.
No, I'll find another way to commit suicide.
C'mon man, it's not as bad as it sounds. A bunch of drunk recruits green as grass with a single NCO...Well, OK, but I was really counting on you, Marked One...
Listen, Marked One... I've done some thinking, and here's what I'd like to offer... Generally speaking, what you really need is to find Strelok. Right?
Let's assume I do.

Anyway, here's the thing about Strelok. There's a stalker that goes by this name. They say he's found a path to the northern reaches of the Zone. And that is a virgin area, a real goldmine for artifacts... Yeah... Anyway, I can help you find him... However... As you can imagine, it won't be a free ride. You'll have to work it off... But in the long run we will both benefit: You're going to waste that Strelok fellow and find out what's happened to you... And I'll find... well, I mean... I'll get my share of our mutual profit, he-he... So what do you say? Deal?
Go on

Alright, listen... You mean business, I can see that... And I... I mean, we need guys like you. We're doing sort of an investigation with some other traders. We want to open up the path to the North, to the centre of the Zone. And near the centre someone or something is trying to hamper our progress... How the heck this Strelok managed to sneak through, I don't know... You see, there's this one area where your brain starts boiling. An eerie place... Anyway, to cut a long story short - a couple of guys have been spying on them grunts for me, not far from here. Apparently, the ones at the Agroprom Research Institute, have dug up something. Something major. I'm positive it has something to do with the centre of the Zone. Anyway, whatever they've dug up, it's secured somewhere on the third floor of the Institute. And we really need this stuff. You see what I mean?
Yes I understand. What if they've found something heavy? What then?

From what I heard... It's apparently a small, white case. Well, Marked One, because stealing it from under the noses of the SBU Special Forces will be very difficult, you'll get paid a lot. They are - tough warriors. You need to be very careful. Maybe you can somehow slip in at night. Can you handle it?
I can try. What do I do next?
Once you have the briefcase, don't bring it here. Take it straight to Barkeep. He runs the stalker bar, the 100 Rads, I'll upload the coordinates and all the data you need to your PDA. Clear?

Well, I'll download the necessary coordinates and information to your PDA. I'll explain it to you, after you leave the Agroprom and arrive at the Garbage, turn right and then go north a couple of kilometres until you reach a checkpoint, then go west. Artifacts sprout in the Garbage like mushrooms after the rain but the place is full of radiation, so I advise you to buy antirads or vodka from me. You don't want to light up like a Christmas tree ... he-he. That's a joke! By the way, I advise you to take a companion - your chances would be better. However, that's up to you. Well good luck.
Thanks. I hope I don't regret this.

We've planned a small deal with the military: we give them ten artifacts, and in return - we get a batch of new weapons which are unaccounted for. As usual, they were sent by mistake: they pretended they were never received, he-he. You need to deliver a bag of artifacts to the military under the bridge and return with the box of weapons. You'll need to use the Zaporozhets we have in camp to bring back the crate of weapons from the bridge. It will be easier for you, you won't damage your back and have to be nursed back to health...\nI hope you'll be able to do it. Understood?
Yes, everything is clear.
Great. Now get yourself to Wolf! Look, this matter is urgent, so don't delay.

Got a job for you, Marked One... I want you to find a stalker called Nimble, he was carrying some very important information. He disappeared somewhere near the bridge. Find him, dead or alive - I don't care, I need the flash drive with the info. Visit Wolf from the local camp, and ask him. He certainly knows where that guy can be.
Is that it?
Hey Marked One, what's up?
Marked One, what are you doing here? I told you to find Nimble!
So, you paid the X18 a visit? Got the documents?
Yeah. Here they are.

Well, well... I see... Now that's interesting, very interesting! If I told anyone they wouldn't believe me! Hmm... Yeah... Oh! Would you just look at that! I didn't expect this... it's pretty bad, eh... Well, here take these back and give them to the Barkeep. Oh, and I owe you for your efforts.

Wait. Here, take this pistol and ammo. You won't last two seconds in the Zone without a weapon! By the way, when you were brought here, you had a knife. I took it off you just in case your head wasn't quite working. You look OK though, so here it is.
Thank you.
So Marked One, any progress on our mutual business?
The choice is yours. Either I brainwash you like I usually do with all the rookies or I treat you like a real stalker and give you a mission straight away.
Hey, Marked One! Good timing, I've got a little job for you.
Treat me like a rookie, I don't remember shit.
Just give me a mission.

Got a job for you, Marked One... I want you to find a stalker called Nimble, he was carrying some very important information. He disappeared somewhere near the bridge. Find him, dead or alive - I don't care, I need the flash drive with the info. Visit Wolf from the local camp, and ask him. He certainly knows where that guy can be. He'll help you with a weapon and ammunition.
Go on.
That's all for now. Bring me the flash drive and we'll consider the fact that you've partially paid me for saving you. Wait, here, this is yours.
OK, I'll try.
Hey, Marked One. Glad to see you alive.
Greetings, Marked One! Did you manage?
Task is complete. Here's the artifact. Interesting.
Great, Marked One. One more little favour - and we're even.
What favour?
The situation is clear. All your messengers were killed except one.
Where's the flash drive with the info?
Here it is.
Great.

Great! Your last task is not difficult. And we'll consider us even.\nWe've got a small deal planned with the "sympathetic representatives" of the local military forces, so to speak. We give them ten artifacts, and in return - we get a batch of new weapons which are unaccounted for. As usual, they were sent by mistake: they pretended they were never received, he-he. You need to deliver a bag of artifacts to the military under the bridge and return with the box of weapons. You'll need to use the Zaporozhets we have in camp to bring back the crate of weapons from the bridge, okay? It will be easier for you, you won't damage your back and have to be nursed back to health. Such an arrangement is not for an amateur. So it should be easy for you... Again...\nNow get yourself to Wolf! Look, this matter is urgent, so don't delay.
Well Marked One, how was the transaction?
It went well, I gave the crate to Wolf.
It's moving ahead slowly.
You're not doing so well, Marked One! Hurry up. We need these guns and as soon as possible.
Not bad stalker. You have style. If you need a job come to us, you are always welcome here. Take the promised reward.

Well, Marked One? You were asked to fetch a box and instead you were out doing god knows what! The simplest task - any rookie could have done it with his eyes closed, but you failed! What, do you only know how to shoot bandits, huh?
Well, it happens. I was the victim of circumstance...
"Circumstances", I understand! So, you don't get a reward. Thank god, at least the flash drive is not broken. Well, it shows, that you're not completely incompetent. You're free to go.
What's the job?
I don't have it.
That's a pity, Marked One, a real pity. We can't talk business until you bring it to me...
Here, take it.
Good...We'll consider that you passed the test. I'd suggest you avoid going to the rookie camp - you might get shot.
Nothing yet.
So, did you bring the artifact?
Not yet.
Well, until you bring it, we've got nothing to talk about. Got it?
Marked One, I've told you everything already. Get out of here!
So Marked One, any news?
Well, have you brought the artifact?
Yes, here it, take it... Fuck... I was lucky I didn't get torn to pieces!
Yes, here it is, take it... By the way, Sidorovich, saw a helicopter near there, it seemed it was attacking someone.
Well, Marked One, you've performed another task. Another couple of small favours - and were even.

Hmm, a helicopter you say? Attacking? Listen, Marked One, return here until it has left and then have a look and see who it was attacking. Only don't poke your nose too close, the pilot can't tell from that height, if you're friend or enemy. If you have binoculars, watch from a distance.
Well don't just stand there, it will fly away while you're hanging around! Run, grab your binoculars and watch!
Not yet, I'm startled by the military chopper. It seems they attacked someone.

Hmm, a helicopter you say? Attacking? Listen, Marked One, return here until it has left and then have a look and see who it was attacking. Only don't poke your nose too close, the pilot can't tell from that height, if you're friend or enemy. If you have binoculars, watch from a distance. At the same time grab the artifact, and leave immediately. Run, while it's circling!
Marked One! Why did you come here, I sent you to rescue the wounded! Hurry, they're out there bleeding to death, if any are still alive!
I am on my way.
I need answers to a few questions.
Ask away but I don't know everything. I sit here all day while life goes on outside, in the Zone. I can tell you about the Zone in general and a little about the nearby areas where I've been myself.
Tell me about the Zone in general.
Ask away.
What does the army do in the Zone?

They guard and protect, what else? No one really knows whether they're guarding the Zone or protecting the rest of the world from it. Sometimes they send whole expeditions here to look for something... But I'll tell you something: they don't respect the Zone and the Zone doesn't like them either, that's why they return home in body bags very often. What else is there? Well, they look down at everyone and act like gods or something. They have no respect for stalker rules and won't ever help you even if you're dying right in front of them. They'll gladly shoot you themselves though, and they don't get reprimanded for that... I've got a few contacts among them... you know, people always need vodka and... umm, ammunition, right? Don't annoy them - they'll whack you for nothing..
Tell me about the Zone.

The Zone... You see, it's not just a circle a few kilometres in diameter with a nuclear power plant in the centre. It's something bizarre. Really bizarre. I doubt anyone in the world could give you a straight answer. I feel the Zone isn't even part of this world. It's a different, detached world, weird and dangerous... and attractive, too. And you know why? Because with a little luck anyone can get rich quick. And the closer you come to the centre of the Zone, the higher you will climb up the money ladder
What's so dangerous about this "different world"?

Hmm... Not a whole lot, except you can croak any second and not know what hit you. A dumb soldier's bullet is the least of your problems, although they've pulled in a lot of military here. Getting shot is basically the most painless kind of death in the Zone. Anomalies, now that's something for you... To die in an anomaly is a terrible thing indeed. Even mutants try to keep away from them. By the way, mutants, these "children of the Zone", are another kind of trouble, so don't go anywhere unarmed. And anyway, to learn about the other dangers, just ask other stalkers.
How does one get rich around here?

Gee, man, what do you think? You don't remember? Artifacts, that's the most important thing here. All sorts of weird toys that come from the Zone are worth a fortune in the Big Land. Artifacts are more precious than gold, diamonds or pure plutonium. Why? Because no jewellery in the world can give you the supernatural powers that these artifacts possess. Just imagine: you can hang a little gadget on your belt that makes bullets swerve by and never hit you! What else? Well, you can find bits and pieces even right here. For the most valuable pieces though, you'll have to get closer to the centre.
Does anyone know what's happening in the centre of the Zone?

It's a different tale every time you hear it. It's a bunch of fairy tales... except I don't believe all that otherworldly nonsense. The one thing I do believe is that the centre of the Zone contains a lot of valuable artifacts. Only I haven't met anyone who went there and managed to come back alive.
Do you know what happened to me?

What kind of question is that? You see, that's some shady business... They found you in a "death truck", that's a... a kind of corpse carrier, right? These trucks come in from the centre of the Zone once in a while, loaded with bodies. No one really knows where they are heading. So, one of them crashed into something and you were found nearby. This is the most amazing thing of all. We've found broken-down corpse carriers before, but no one ever came out of them alive. I'm sorry, bro, that's all I can help you with. The rest you'll have to figure out for yourself.
Who is Strelok?

Yeah, I've heard of a stalker by that name. Rumours is he's one of the few who went to the centre of the Zone and made it back. Still, we got so many of these legendary stories about stalker heroes that I can't really guarantee anything. At any rate, I've never dealt with him personally. It seems he has his own trading channels. Anyhow, just ask the folks here in the Zone and you'll be sure to learn a lot more.
Who is this stalker, Ghost?
Heh, that's another local legend. We haven't had any news from him in a long while. I suppose he perished somewhere deep in the Zone.
What's going on in this neighbourhood?

Huh! This is the entrance to the Zone, a sort of an antechamber. We've got an army cordon here. It's relatively quiet, with the exception of a couple of army guys who like to have some fun, go on shakedown runs. Experienced stalkers don't come by very often, so it's mostly rookies. Some settle here for good, yeah... A little ways from here there's a farm made into a rookie camp. Watch yourself though, they aren't afraid to pull the trigger when push comes to shove. What else? You won't make huge profits here, that's for sure. There's a deserted factory across the road. To the North, behind the railroad embankment there are the ruins of a farm. An army outpost lies to the South of here. And beware: the military left some mines in the ground. Also, there used to be a bridge in the centre, but it went down somehow. That's about it, really.
Tell me more about the army outpost.

The few soldiers there have been ordered to shoot on sight, so you'd better walk around it and try not to show your ass. If you piss them off, they may call for the Spetsnaz from the further cordon. Those guys can brew up such shit that I won't have any customers for a month... I know the commander a little: he likes to take a swig as much as the next man. I'm only surviving here thanks to him.
I want to know more about the fallen bridge.

That's just a couple of minutes North of here, you'll see it right away. There used to be a bridge over the road, but then it collapsed during one of the emissions. The army guys built a checkpoint there and don't let anyone through... but if you grease the right palm, you'll pass with no problems. In general, you don't want to show your face there too much, unless you're badly wounded or got a heavy load on you.
Got some more info about the factory?

Cross the road and you'll see a brick building - that's it. Everything worth stealing has already been stolen, just this one box is left. This is the bandits' favourite place. I don't know if they are there now, but watch out just in case. You got nothing valuable on you to take, but do you really want to go through all that?
Tell me about the farm.
You're getting boring, you know that? It's just a farm like any other. The place used to thrive before democracy broke out.
Thanks, that's all
I'd like to find out more.
Tell me about this place.

Huh! This is the entrance to the Zone, a sort of an antechamber. We've got an army cordon here. It's relatively quiet, with the exception of a couple of army guys who like to have some fun, go on shakedown runs. Experienced stalkers don't come by very often, so it's mostly rookies. Some settle here for good, yeah... A little ways from here there's a farm made into a rookie camp. Watch yourself though, they aren't afraid to pull the trigger when push comes to shove. What else? You won't make huge profit here, that's for sure. There's a deserted factory across the road. To the North, behind the railroad embankment there are the ruins of a farm. An army outpost lies to the South of here. And beware: the military left some mines in the ground. Also, there used to be a bridge in the centre, but it went down somehow. That's about it, really.
OK, thanks.
Tell me more about the army outpost

The few soldiers there have been ordered to shoot on sight, so you'd better walk around it and try not to show your ass. If you piss them off, they may call for the Spetsnaz from the further Cordon. Those guys can brew up such shit that I won't have any customers for a month... I know the commander a little: he likes to take a swig as much as the next man. I'm surviving on here thanks to him.
I want to know more about the fallen bridge.

That's just a couple of minutes North of here - you'll see it right away. There used to be a bridge over the road, but then it collapsed during one of the blowouts. The army guys built a checkpoint there and don't let anyone through... but if you grease the right palm, you'll pass with no problems. In general, you don't want to show your face there too much, unless you're badly wounded or got a heavy load on you.
Got some more info about the factory?

Cross the road and you'll see a brick building - that's it. Everything worth stealing has already been stolen, just this one box is left. This is the bandits' favourite place. I don't know if they are there now, but watch out just in case. You got nothing valuable on you to take, but do you really want to go through all that?
Tell me about the farm.
You're getting boring, you know that? It's just a farm like any other. The place used to thrive before democracy broke out.
Oh, damn, the pain is too much... I'm dying...
You're, still alive?
Yes, barely... I'm bleeding heavily. Can you give me a medkit?
Sorry, brother. Nope, no medkits.
Search the bodies ... One of the guys in our group ... should have one.
Just hang tight, I won't be long...
Take it.
Phew... now... I feel a little better...
So get well soon.

Thank you. I wont forget it. You cannot imagine how grateful I am. Let's go to the camp, I'll let Wolf know how much you helped me!... He's our leader, in the village, and knows everything that goes on around here.
Well, let's go.
I saw that you have one. The Zone will punish you, you louse...
I don't care about this nonsense...
Well how are you?
Not too good, but I'll live. Damn, why haven't I saved up enough to buy decent body armour. Takes a fool to go deep inside the Zone without it.
Look, now I've saved you, at least tell me, what's your real name, and where are you from?

I thank you. I'll say that there are times when you just want to forget. So for you, I am just Tolik. That's all. Sometimes when people come here their real names are not known, only a nickname is used. And some stalkers use forged id's and use someone else's name. I suppose that you have a nickname. Sometimes stalkers forget their real names. And some, when leaving the Zone to go to the mainland and back use fake names. No one cares what our real names are anyway. I digress, to answer your question I am from the glorious city of Khabarovsk.
I understood. I'm not a fool. Tell me... what equipment do I need.

Well, this is no problem. First of all, an automatic assault weapon is necessary in the Zone. Personally, I prefer the AK, but Sidorovich sells NATO weapons as well. I myself, haven't used one, but dudes like Wolf speak highly of them. Then you need a handgun to shoot small animals, like tushkanos or blind dogs. When you come across them - you'll see what I mean.
