Next, depending on the situation, you need a shotgun or sniper rifle. Sidorovich always has shotguns! I've been wanting to buy a sawn-off for a long time. Occasionally, he'll have a sniper rifle. He also sells grenades and body armour. When anybody, like Wolf, goes deep into the Zone, they always wear good body armour. If you haven't got good body armour - you can't consider yourself a stalker. If you work for me - I'll get you stuff on the cheap.
I don't want to work for anybody.

Well then, let me give you some advice. Almost free, but not useless. What's the most valuable thing in the Zone? That's right - information. Sometimes it's of more benefit than a gun or a gas mask. And most importantly, it's easier to use. One press of a button - and the information is instantly there. Therefore, most stalkers keep information of their caches, in their PDA. If you need help for example, just press a button... You'll know everything that has happened in the Zone - even if Wolf had a hangover in the morning. Send an S.O.S. message and everyone will come running, hoping to get your cache location. If the stalker has died, he no longer needs the stash whose information is still in his PDA. You see, your PDA also acts as a decoder. Look, you can earn yourself a good loot this way.
Thank you, I'll consider it.
Do you have any more interesting work?

So you want interesting work? Hmm... Well, Marked One... There was an order from behind the perimeter. A customer needs artifacts. Don't turn up your nose! Just listen! These are not common artifacts, they're what stalkers call "dummies". Ever heard of them? \nNow then. A full set is needed. I'll give you a list. Frankly speaking, I haven't seen all of them. They are rare around here. Whoever finds them - usually keeps them, they are too good to sell, though buying them - may be possible. \nWhat about it? Interested?
Sidorovich! Do you have any idea, in what shitty places I'll have to search?
I'll tell you what! I know that you don't want to search. But most importantly - I know you can find them! All right, all right... I'll make it worth your while. You know me, you won't regret it.
Come on, out with it, what have you got up your sleeve.

Well ... Listen... \nA stalker came to me about three months ago... You may have already met such people - he was burnt out from being in the Zone... He hold me, he was leaving the Zone because of this, and wanted to get rid of all his gear! I could see he was quite frustrated.
Get to the point! Speak up!

Don't be so impatient! \nHe dropped everything on the counter, said I could have, and took off. Straight away, I noticed he had some pretty good stuff. But one thing stood out. It must have been sickly expensive. But outside the perimeter, there are no buyers. It was an interesting protective suit. The likes of which I've never seen. I know they have similar ones in the mobile lab at Yantar. No one else will have one. I'll give it to you. Are you up to it?
Well, I'll try.
No, Sidorovich. Even for such a wonderful suit, I won't go to hell and back. Don't think badly of me.
Well, as you wish. That's your business. I'll find someone else.
Well, Sidorovich take the goods! That's everything on the list.
Well, Marked One, you've made an old man happy! Here's your reward. While you were away, I dollied the suit up a bit, so now it's as good as new. Take it!
Sidorovich, can you find me some transport? Something not radioactive...

Why not? It's possible! There's just one condition: you'll have to pick it up yourself. Unless you're using it as part of a task - I'll provide the fuel. But specifically, you cannot take it cross the transition. Other than that - you're free to go - wherever you please. If you agree - say where you want to drive...
In the Cordon.

In the Cordon you can drive a paddock Goat, a UAZ 469. It's a little beat up, but it still runs. It will cost you 9,000 roubles. Money up front! \nOr you can take the Zaporozhets next to the second last house... If you can get it to run! Ha-ha!.. But it's free!
Well... I'll take the Goat...
Hell! For that kind of money... I could buy a ZAZ 'Humpback'... you extortionist
The Goat is yours. You can get it at the ATP garage.
At the Garbage.
At the Garbage... Yeah ... There's a 412 and a UAZ. Costing 8000 and 11000, respectively. Money up front - as usual!
I'll take the Moskvich 412...
The Moskvich is yours. Parked in the vehicle cemetery. At the same time you can help out there...
I'll take the UAZ.
The UAZ is yours. It will be at the ruined building near the 'Duty' checkpoint.
Damn... not enough money.
At the Agroprom.
So. I can offer you a Goat or a Niva. For 12,000 and 11,000 respectively.... Or you can fight the military at the SRI for the Moskvich... He-he-he...
I'll take the UAZ... Profiteer...
Take it, it's available near the railway tunnel...
I'll take the Niva.
You will find it there... On the road after leaving the Institute...
When are you going to stop ripping off stalkers?
In Dark Valley.
I have a UAZ delivery van there. 15000 roubles. It's a dangerous place.
All right then.
The van is yours. It will be at the filling station opposite Borov's base.
Oops... not enough money... I'll be back later.
The Bar.
The Bar... At the bar is a Niva. it will cost you 12000 roubles...
Why is it so expensive? I'd expect something customised...
Take it, it's near the road opposite the fuel tanker.
I don't have enough money... Maybe another time.
At Yantar.
Very well! ZAZ 'big-eared'! Small and unreliable! 8000 total!
Come on... You thief...
Take it! You will immediately see it, as you enter the valley!
Will you take less for it?
Nothing doing!
Sidorovich... help... me...
Marked One! Is that you?
Help...
Do you recognise me?
You...Sidorovich...
So, Marked One. This is a serious matter. Well - you need to go to the scientists at Yantar. Find Sakharov. Perhaps he can help you. Do you hear me?
I... will... try...
Stalkers are after my hide, please help me!
Okay, but these services are not cheap. I can resolve your problems. Are you willing to pay 20,000 roubles?
Yes, I want to restore relations with stalkers.
No, I changed my mind. I don't care about my relations with stalkers.

Yes, of course I do. But not about your honour. I would love to hear the story about how you managed to escape the "death truck"... \nI just don't understand: what are these trucks, where are they going, and, most importantly, why? Who are the 'passengers' and what does that tattoo mean? I've seen most of the Zone, but I've never seen anybody with that tattoo before. \nI once heard from a hardened stalker that he lost his partner during an expedition. His partner had passed away quickly and in peace during an emission...

The cause was not the emission, but something else. Well, the stalker tried for some time to find and revive his old friend - but he was gone! I think the Zone had removed his companion.\nBecause, a month later, his friend appeared in the Bar: dejected, wearing a burnt suit, and carrying a different weapon... And most interesting - he arrived from the Marshes, even though he disappeared in the Red Forest! How he got there, the stalker could not explain and on his arm... Guess what? A tattoo, just like yours!

It's best not to be alone during these events. It makes everything gloomy. You will most likely start shaking. Some call it 'Time of Terror' and some call it 'Psi-emissions'. All normal people get fucked up.

First, I try to get out of enclosed spaces, because it is easier to dodge the pervasive phantoms. Secondly, I try to clear my mind so that my the head does not hurt too much, and to be alert in time to shoot all the ghosts and Zone monsters.

No one really knows. Some say that the phantoms - are a product of our imagination. It is known that the phantoms pursue only specific stalkers, and don't touch others. Scientists in Yantar say that the ghosts are born only if there are living stalkers nearby.

This is what we call the psi-emission. It often happens after a normal emission. It is so named because at this time something specifically starts to put pressure on the psyche. All sorts of bad thoughts and hallucinations start to come to our brothers. Phantoms appear, which can burn out the brain. They say that our thoughts somehow contribute to the appearance of these phantoms. During this time the less you think the less there is risk of phantoms. We can also escape them by drinking vodka. It helps greatly. By the way, do you happen to have any vodka by chance?
That's-that!
Heh! You arrived in the Zone yesterday.
Consider it the way it is.

This often happens after an emission. Have you noticed how everything has become gloomy? Humans can neither eat nor sleep. Stalkers call it - the Time of Terror. Well, whatever they call it, it's sickening. The deeper into the Zone you go - the worse it gets. For rookies it's hard times of course, but then they get used to. So be patient, Marked One. \nWhat it's all about and from where it comes - I don't know. But it's not good for you - that's for sure. Well, maybe the scientists in the field laboratory at Yantar may know more. If you want to know more - go to them or just ask around.
Well, it's all clear now. Thank you.

Your first task is to get a "Blood Stone" artifact. \nNear here is a ravine with various anomalies. The artifact is somewhere in the centre of it. Local rookies from the camp are afraid to go there, but I can see from the expression on your face that you are no novice. So, even with your addled mind, you should be able get it. I'll mark the coordinates of the search area on your PDA. Oh, by the way, they don't want to let you into the camp yet. They don't trust you... And basically I don't as well. Let's see how you do and if your head is on straight - I'll put in a good word for you.
Understood. Anything else?
No, just go do the job!
Well okay, I'll go.
Get going, find the artifact!
Well, did you bring the artifact?
Yes, here it is, take it... Phew... I was almost ripped to pieces!
Well, Marked One, the job is done. I have another small task - and then we're even.
What task?
Not yet.
Well, until you bring it, I have no more to say, Come on, fetch the artifact!
Marked One, why are you still here? I told you - find the artifact!
Wolf, I found the dynamite. Here you are.
Oh! Thank you, Marked One. Well done. I owe you one.
Happy to help.
Wolf, do you need a box of dynamite?
A box of dynamite? Where did you get it?
Where I got it, is not important! Hurry up: Do you want it or not?
What do you want for it?
1000 and the dynamite is yours.

Stalker, don't you think the price is a bit steep? Here, judge for yourself, which is more profitable to me: should I pay you and take the dynamite, or keep my 1,000 and spend a few roubles on a fifty-calibre bullet to put into your head and then take the dynamite?
I think that the second option is more profitable for you.
Yes I think so too. I'll only pay you 500 for the dynamite.
Okay, done.
You can have it for 500 roubles.
Deal! Here's the money. I'll take the dynamite now.
It's been nice dealing with you. See you!
How's Tolik?
He's okay, he'll live. You got him out of a tough scrape. I think you are a good fighter... This is for you, for helping him out, take it. Thank you, Marked One.
And thank you. Today I helped you, and tomorrow, someone may help me.
Wow, man. What happened?

Well, I really don't know. A group of scouts came across a wounded stalker and brought him to me - I did first year at medical school, so some of the guys consider me the local healer. I help the guys as best I can, I try to keep them alive and healthy.\nBut this stalker is in very bad shape, there's not much I can do to help him...
What about him? Do we know who he is, or where he came from.

They found him two days ago near the farm, in the morning. A lot of shooting and screams was heard coming from that direction during the night before. So in the morning, they dispatched a group from camp to check out what happened. They found him, wounded. The poor chap had a few deep wounds, apparently from a knife. And a couple of bullet wounds, though not life threatening at the moment.
Can you get the bullets out?
Hardly... he needs a good field surgeon, you must understand... I did what I could, but alas, that wasn't enough.
Can I help you?

If anything here can somehow alleviate his suffering, it's the very Zone itself... The only option - is to resort to its anomalous energy. I would try to use an artifact that enhances health, but I don't have one. If you find such an artifact bring it to me, maybe it will help.
Where can I find one in the Cordon?

In the Cordon, such artifacts are a rarity. But sometimes you can come across one. Just yesterday, a rookie at the campfire swore that he saw a "Meat Chunk" not far from the grain elevator. He said, if it wasn't for a big pack of rats, he would have picked it up. Was he telling the truth, who knows...
I ought to check.
I brought the artifact as requested, here it is.
Well, now I'll try to help this wounded stalker... It looks like he's getting better!
%c[255,255,118,118]What's the situation around the camp?%c[default]

Unstable, what else... The bandits don't come in here - they're too afraid. They just prowl around, like jackals! Recently, some Loner was seriously injured not far from here. He was barely alive when our guys found him. He's now in the cellar, being nursed by our healer.
What kind of a Loner?
In appearance he's a simple stalker, but definitely not a local. If you want, you can see for yourself. I haven't spoken to him yet, here's only been here one day.
Why is it so dark?
Quiet, save your strength. Can you talk?
It's dark... very dark...
Are you okay?
Is it you, are you the one?... Oh, I don't feel so good...
I'm - Marked One. What happened to you?
Damn, I don't understand, where am I... Digger, do you hear me? Digger? Take my piece of information, you have to keep it!
Who's Digger? What information? Listen to me: lie still, save your strength.
Digger, I am dying... tell the leader, I told them nothing. If you find the Klondike - send my share to my family... The coordinates are in my tablet, at my cache... Oh... Everybody...
Wait a minute!
It seems he died.
It's a pity, of course, but that's to be expected - he had lost too much blood. The artifact helped, but couldn't save him. Did he tell you who he was and where he was going?
No, he just kept going on about some "Digger". He also said something about a cache with a tablet that has coordinates in it. What could it mean?
Well! That's interesting... Anything else?
No, nothing.
I see. It's probably nonsense and not worth checking out. I suppose bandits would have already cleaned it out.
Who knows. I can check it out just in case.
Bear in mind... I wouldn't be in a hurry - the bandits could still be close by.
We meet again! What are you doing here?
Just sitting... Why?
What's that box next to you?
I don't know. A box is a box... There are boxes everywhere around here.
What was in it?
In what respect? How would I know? I came here for a reason... To take a leak. Then you bail me up with stupid questions.
Do you always wander this far away? It's not advisable to poke your nose in every village.
Well you're boring me, man! Just go, before something happens to you.
What, for instance? Shut up!
Uh-uh... I simply meant... This is a dangerous place...
Give me what was in the cache, and then you can go free.
What happens if I don't?! What gives you the right to take it?
These items are not yours.
They are not yours either! This is the Zone pal. First come, first served. And in this case, it's me. So, it's my loot!
Really, well then... You're right in saying that this is dangerous and anything can happen. There's bandits out there... You could catch a stray bullet...
That would be bad luck! Anyway, you won't hurt me, otherwise you won't get what was in the cache! Let's behave like civilized people.
%c[255,255,118,118]You, you scoundrel, you lack "civility"! Give me the loot, or you'll be sorry!%c[default]
Well, what do you want?
Quid pro quo. You give me an artifact, and I'll give you the loot.
Is that something worthwhile?
The devil knows, but I think so. I just don't have time now to mess with it now, as you can see.
Good. What is the artifact you need?
I need a "Stone Flower".
Okay, I'll get you the "Stone Flower". Look, just stay here until I find it.
I will try.
Here's your artifact, I hope you choke on it.
Okay, don't grumble, you rogue. Just keep in mind, how to extract a loot without risk.
One more lesson like that and no loot will help you.

Okay, okay. The cache had a tablet with some documents. More precisely, it was a kind of book, something like a diary, with notes. I briefly read through it, it was mostly just crap. If you're so interested, look for the tablet on the roof of the barn. I threw it up there when you suddenly appeared.
Clear. You did tell anyone about what you know?
Of course not. I value my skin, and obviously, you aren't the friendly type...
Well, you could be right. I'm glad we understand each other.
You've finally arrived? I thought you were dead. I have been waiting here for two days.
Do we know each other?
Wait, you're the wrong person... I thought that you're one of my clients. Why do you need me?
I need Veteran's flash drive.
Why should I suddenly give it to you?
He died and bequeathed it to me.
Okay. I'll give it to you ... But there's a catch.
What is it?

You see, I'm a digger. I like to go into the underground utilities and rummage through heaps of garbage looking for loot. Recently, I found an old Soviet safe in an abandoned house, and wanted to open it, but it has a combination lock. I think there may be something valuable in there. I can remember, in my youth, I could drink two bottles of vodka, and not even stagger, and at the same time, have a clear head, but now, I cannot. Help me open the safe, and I'll give you the flash drive.
Let's try.
No, it's not for me.
The safe is over there in the corner.
I opened the safe.
Well, what was in there?
There was only this book.
A book? And nothing like gold or jewels?
No, just the book.
Damn! If I knew, I wouldn't have bothered...
How about Veteran's flash drive?
Yes... Vaska Podaypatron, my assistant has it. He's at the Garbage near the Duty checkpoint. Go see him.
Thank you. What do I do with this book?
Keep it.
Old man, give me some advice. Where you can I get hold of a good loot?

Oh, you're a businessman! Have you done enough good deeds in the Zone to merit a loot? I know you young people: always rushing and scurrying about, wanting everything in a hurry for little effort... They are unaccustomed to hard work. That's okay, they just don't want to use their heads!..
Don't grumble old man. I'm not squeamish about a bit of work.
Really? Well then how about: you work a little and earn something. But it will be necessary to work with your head, not your hands. You understand what I mean?
Hum, I think so.
I am going to tell you some riddles. For each correct answer, I'll give you the location where I hid some loot. Here in the Darkscape, I have lots of hiding places! Well, are you ready?
Of course, go ahead.
Old man, ask the riddle.

Barkeep decided one morning that it would be necessary to mow the grass in the fields near the Bar so that any approaching mutants could be spotted. He then hired some stalkers, and they began to mow. One field was twice the size of the other. For half a day, the stalker team mowed the larger field. After that, they split into two: The first group remained at the large field and kept mowing it until they finished at the end of the evening; the second group of stalkers mowed the smaller field, and by the evening, there was a plot left in the second field that could be fully mown the next day by one stalker, on his own. How many stalkers did he hire to mow the grass?

It takes 10 days for one stalker to go from the Cordon to Pripyat and another, 15 days using the same route. If both they both set off in opposite directions at the same time, one from Pripyat, and the other from the Cordon, after how many days they will meet?

Once a stalker helped another to peel potatoes and together, they managed to peel 400 pieces. The first stalker peeled three per minute, while the second, peeled two per minute. The second stalker worked for 25 minutes longer than the first, because the first one left to look for artifacts. How long did the first stalker help the second one to peel potatoes?

A flock of geese are flying towards Pripyat, and an eagle meets them. The eagle says: "Hello, one hundred geese." The geese reply "We are not a hundred geese, but much less. If we had as many again, and even so, had half as many, and then a quarter as many, and you joined our pack, that's when we would be a hundred." If we assume that the eagle will join the flock and fly with them, how many geese were in the flock at the time of this epic meeting?

Recently, a stalker asked me:
- How old are you?
I replied:
 - If I live another half as long as what I've lived, and add one year, I will be 100 years old. How old am I?
I saw a flock of geese. One goose was in front and two behind. One behind and two in front, one between two and three in a row. How many were there?

36 Chernobyl crows were perched in three trees. Suddenly, six crows flew from the first tree to the second, then four crows flew from the second tree to the third so that all trees held an equal number or crows. How many crows were in each tree originally?

Professor Sakharov discovered a surprising variety of amoebas. Each minute they divided into two. The biologist puts one amoeba in a test tube, and in an hour, the test tube was filled with amoebas. How long would it take to fill the test tube with amoebas, if he put two in instead of one?

I have two pockets with money in them; when I shift one rouble from one pocket to another, the amount in each pocket will be equal, and when I shift the rouble back to the second pocket, what's in the first will be more than half what's in the second. How many roubles are in each pocket?

Professor Kruglov gave four irradiated stalkers 2006 antirad tablets. The Duty soldier received one more than the Freedom member; the mercenary, one more than the Duty soldier, and the Loner - one more than the mercenary. How many tablets did the Loner receive?
If three Chernobyl cats can eat three Chernobyl rats in three minutes, then how long will it take thirty cats to eat thirty rats?

In the Dark Valley was a herd of pseudo-giants, a pack of blind dogs and a bunch of Chernobyl cats. There were more dogs than pseudo-giants. Between the dogs and the giants there was a total of 100 heads and legs put together. Also the total number of dogs and giants together was three times more than the number of cats. How many cats were there in the Dark Valley?

A Duty squad got into a bit of bother: while crossing a river, two out of the three soldiers got all their cartridges wet, and these became unusable. The three warriors divided equally between themselves what was left of their ammunition. After everyone made four shots, their combined total of cartridges, was the amount each had received at the time of sharing. How many suitable cartridges did the Duty member share?

Sidorovich makes a deal with a Stalker-hunter and promises him 0.5 roubles for every pseudo dog skin he brings him and 3 roubles for every wild boar skin. He pays 10 roubles for a chimera skin. "Well," said the stalker, "I'll get you all the skins for 100 roubles. You will receive exactly 100 pieces. Can you tell me, how may pseudo dog, wild boar and chimera hides should I bring you?"

30 bloodsuckers live inside the X-18 laboratory, which are gradually eating each other to death. A bloodsucker is considered well fed, if he has eaten three of his relatives. What is the greatest number of bloodsuckers that can be satisfied in the same meal?
One veteran stalker can drink a keg of beer on his own in 14 days, but along with his buddy it takes them just 10 days. How many days will it take his buddy to drink a keg of beer by himself?

A stalker entered the 100 Rads Bar and asked the bartender for a glass of water. They had never met before. The bartender pulled out a gun from under the counter and pointed it at the Stalker. The stalker then said "thank you" and left. What had just happened?

Five stalkers, three veterans and two novices equally share a loot they have earned during a campaign. In the loot there were three artifacts. They couldn't be divided, so they were taken by the three veteran stalkers. Each of veterans paid 80 roubles to the novices. The novices then divided this money among themselves, and then all five stalkers had an equal amount of valuables. How much were the artifacts worth?
How many fingers are on a controller's hand?
Oh, my memory is like a sieve! I wanted to ask you a riddle, but I forgot. Wait, let me think...
What was the thermal power output of the reactor at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant?
8 stalkers
12 stalkers
10 stalkers
6 stalkers
7 stalkers
After 3 days
After 6 days
After 5 days
After 7 days
After 10 days
30 minutes
45 minutes
60 minutes
70 minutes
80 minutes
40 geese
36 geese
43 geese
20 geese
42 geese
80 years
70 years
75 years
66 years
58 years
59 minutes
60 minutes
30 minutes
29 minutes
25 minutes
6 and 6 roubles
4 and 8 roubles
3 and 9 roubles
10 and 2 roubles
5 and 7 roubles
634 tablets
500 tablets
1000 tablets
503 tablets
1100 tablets
3 minutes
90 minutes
60 minutes
6 minutes
45 minutes
15 cats
10 cats
8 cats
12 cats
7 cats
20 rounds
18 rounds
35 rounds
15 rounds
25 rounds
Skins from 50 Pseudo dogs, 45 boars, 5 chimeras
Skins from 12 Pseudo dogs, 80 boars, 8 chimeras
Skins from 80 Pseudo dogs, 15 boars, 5 chimeras
Skins from 72 Pseudo dogs, 18 boars, 10 chimeras
Skins from 94 Pseudo dogs, 1 boars, 5 chimeras.
25 days
20 days
35 days
28 days
21 days
It was the old Dutier Bartender.
It was the Black Stalker.
The stalker covertly stuck out a loaded shotgun.
The stalker had the hiccups.
The stalker was pretending to be a Controller.
250 for each
200 for each
300 for each
450 for each
500 for each
5 fingers
4 fingers
The controller has no hands.
6 fingers
4 On the left, 5 on the right.
3200 megawatts
4800 megawatts
5400 megawatts
4250 megawatts
5250 megawatts
Let's guess the riddle.
Think before you answer, the last time you guessed! Just think and then come. I still have caches in stock.
Well young greenhorn. Go and think it through.
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is at the sawmill, near a pile of logs under a canopy. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is at the sawmill, inside the shop with the saw bench. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.
Good for you, you clever fellow, Listen to me, the cache is located on top of a hill to the south, under a large evergreen shrub. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is on a concrete parapet, near the old barn that is near the transition to Cordon. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is in a huge pile of boulders about fifty metres from the transition to Cordon. I put on your PDA a description so you won't forget where to look
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is located on the roof of a littered tunnel. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is located at the abandoned gas station. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is located near the collapsed rail bridge. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is near the bridge across the river which is overgrown with vegetation. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is located in a cosy place in an abandoned farm to the north, where I used to live. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look..
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is located in the technology wreckage strewn around near a tunnel. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: go from the broken rail bridge to the south, on the right side of the road turn into a forest. Look about a hundred steps to the right of some rocks. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: go from the poisonous puddles towards the Cordon, go a hundred metres and then look to the left. There you will see a large fallen tree with a rock under it. Look there. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: go out of my house and head north west right into a thicket. As you reach the cliffs, look closely and you will see three small stones and a red spruce there. Look between the stones. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: somewhere right here in this shack are hidden valuables, but I forgot where. Damn sclerosis, hope you don't suffer from it. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.
Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the cache is located to the east of the sawmill on a hill under a bush. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: you will go a hundred metres from the railway bridge towards a farm. Then look to the right, you will see a lot of rocks and stones. Find two of them, the most enormous standing side-by-side. Somewhere close to them and is my loot. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: not to far to the North of a farm and a bit to the right you see a pile of boulders. Behind them is a cache. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: at the sawmill there is an old toilet. Search somewhere near it. Just do not step on any crap! I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.

Good for you, you clever fellow! Listen to me: the hiding place is not far from the road fork, there are some rusty looking rocks there. I marked the location in your PDA so you won't forget where to look.
If your ass is looking for adventure, you've come to the right place. What the fuck do you want?
Don't get angry, mate. I've come in peace.
I have a business proposal.
Who are you and what are you doing here?
We are cut-throats and brigands, blah! Have you heard of Kulgavy? We are from his gang.
I see.
%c[255,255,118,118]I want carve up your ass so it looks like the British flag, you faggot!%c[default]
I'm not your mate, I am a bandit. And you are a simpleton... Why have you come here, you tosser?
May I suggest: you leave those stalkers alone, and they will return the captive. I can arrange it.

Leave them alone, you say? Well, why not? Only on one condition: that they lay down their arms and don't try anything. We'll sit here until Flea arrives, and then we'll leave. We won't lay a finger on them, trust me!
Well then, I'll persuade them not to shoot.
Well, explain.
I want to help my team. What do I need to do?
Ah, so you're like the local Robin-hood? Well... in short: tell the simpleton who is entrenched opposite us, to release Flea, or we'll wipe them all out! And Flea better be unharmed. Understand?
I'll try to release Flea.
No, that won't do.
Are you all alive and well?
Yes, everything is fine. My name is Yuri, nice to meet you. By the way, here's a reward for your help:
Our unit suffered some losses, so I'm not in the mood for jokes. Here, take a little loot for your help...
Damn, where did you come from? Those fucking bandits threatened all my guys! You know what... You got here just in time.
The bandits who threatened you are dead.
Finally! Now we can breathe easily.
Did they want something from you?
Yes, those bastards want to rob us, but we captured their scout. That's why they didn't attack. Now we can release the prisoner.
Of course.
The bandits, under the guise of a deal, wanted to attack you. Now they are destroyed.
I knew those criminals couldn't be trusted!
What now?
I don't think they send help. This place is a backwater and Kulgavy doesn't have a lot of people.
I don't think they'll send backup. The place is deaf and the Kulgava gang is not too numerous. This is for your help:
All's well Yuri. The bandits have left.
Man, you're just a born diplomat! How can I thank you enough, then? What do you want: money or artifacts?
Give me money, it will never become redundant.
Better artifacts, they can be very useful sometimes.
I don't need anything. No one got hurt, so that's payment enough.
I won't take no for an answer! Take this, in gratitude from the Searchers:
Look, I spoke with their chief, he promised to let you go peacefully, if you release the prisoner.

Intelligent people say: never trust thieves... Although on the other hand, I have no choice! We can't sit here forever, right? In short, tell him that we agree and will release the prisoner. Just remember this: if the bandits don't keep their word, it will be on your conscience!
Trust me, everything will be fine.
I made a deal with stalkers about the prisoner. They released him and now want to leave.
They released Flea? That's great! Okay guys, let's exterminate these goats! Cut them to pieces!
You promised that you wouldn't touch them!
Simpleton, I don't understand, are you also a sucker? Get out of the way and let the lads get on with it.
Wait!
Well, the simpleton got his ass kicked!
Ah, well done! Here's a little something for you:
Alright, thank you!
Why did you lie to me? You promised you would not attack the Searchers, if they released the prisoner!
Remember simpleton: there's no honour among thieves! We don't fuck around, understand??
I will remember this lesson...
%c[255,255,118,118]Eat lead, you piece of shit!%c[default]
Can you tell me what kind of information you have?
Fuck you, sucker!
%c[255,255,118,118]Die, you bitch!%c[default]
Maybe, we can come to an agreement?
Get me a kosher artifact set then I'll tell you!
What do you mean by a 'kosher artifact' set?
Blah, well you're stupid! In short, bring me a "Soul", a "Flash" and a "Mica", understood? I won't wait long, that's the deal baby!
Okay, I get them.
Here are the artifacts you asked for.

You've done well, simpleton! In short, you go along the fence near the Sawmill and near the gate will find a backpack under a bush with a flash drive inside. What's in it, you ask? I don't know and don't really care.
Hello man. Who are you?
A simple Stalker from the Searchers group. We were a large group once, but most are gone, we are the last of them.
What did you do?
We scout for secret paths. We want to find a way past the "brain scorcher" to the centre of the Zone.
Have you found it?

We didn't have time - some bastards ambushed our expedition and slaughtered almost all of us. So we came here to recuperate, so as not to attract too much attention, but it didn't turn out well for us...
How you doing, soldier?
Listen, you are a real peacemaker, you rescued us! If it wasn't for you, these thieves would have tore us apart!
Good thing I came along. I'm glad I could help.
What's up, man?
We're bandits you peasant! Open your eyes! We sit here on guard, you simpleton...
Why?
So those stalker reptiles don't go anywhere!
Is everything okay?
More or less. We got tied up in one hell of a fight here simpleton, but now we reign supreme.
Well, hello!
Hi, who are you?
I'm the local celebrity.
What are you famous for?
I play guitar and sing songs about the Zone. I can sing you a song if you offer me some vodka.
Of course I will, here.
I don't have any vodka.
Thank you, you saved a sick man.
Play something.
No, I'll come another another time.
About the Chernobyl Disaster.
About the Chernobyl Guerrillas.
About the "Monolith" Stone.
Stories you have heard.
Farewell to the Zone.
About the Sarcophagus.
About the City of Chernobyl.
About the Evacuation of the Zone.
Yuri, I'm looking for someone.
Who is he?
A stalker named Chatterbox. He was supposed to be here.
Chatterbox, yes, he was here. Why are you looking for him?
He came to you for a map, right?

Well, if you must know, then listen up. Yes, he was here. And, apparently, it was he who led the bandits to the sawmill, but it wasn't his fault. Before the attack, Chatterbox left and I think some of the bandits followed him.
Where was he going?
To the west. To the Hunter's place, to lie low for a while. The Hunter lives there in an abandoned hut.
Clearly, it's necessary to visit him.
You're the Black Stalker, if I'm not mistaken?
In person. With whom do I have the pleasure of speaking?
Nice to meet you, I'm a stalker called Marked One... Great weather today, isn't it?
Simply magnificent! However you didn't come here to discuss the benefits of the local weather.
Yes, I must confess. The fact is that I would really like to get the notorious artifact called "Light".
Ah, so that's it... I see you know a lot about the rare artifact! I would be pleased to take you to the grave of the unfortunate who had it before his death.
And you ask for nothing in return?
Imagine that! However, I'm standing in the presence of someone who is worthy of praise. By the way, do you see my dog?
Is his name Chestnut?

Oh, I see that the rumours of my adventures with him are already quite widespread, that's good! But remember, my friend: in the long journey ahead, you must protect this precious animal at all costs. As you have already noticed, I am totally blind, but at the same time, I can see you. How, you ask? Well, because I share a common sight with Chestnut; I see what he sees. Accordingly, if something happens to my dear dog, the consequences for you personally will be very bad. What do you think?
Fair enough. It's a deal.

Great. Follow my dog and look after us both! Oh, and one more thing: if the worst were to happen, then you better kill me, or you will die yourself! You have been warned! Then you will seek me in this very place.
Okay.
Why didn't you tell me, that you would turn into a monster?
You should have guessed. You knew who you were dealing with.
Can we try again?
Yes, but now you know what will happen, if you don't protect my Chestnut.
Why don't you protect him?
The Zone has forbade me to kill mortals in human form.
Interesting condition...
What happened?
Chestnut has picked up a scent. Prepare your weapon.
Good. Is it a man?
I think so.
Clear.
Is this the place?

Behold: before us is the grave where I had buried one of his friends. I know why you needed a "light" artifact - you want to get into the Death-zone to get a part of map that shows the location of the Klondike of artifacts.
How do you know?

Well, I am the Black Stalker. Now I will go into the abnormal hearth and fetch the artifact, but I will not give it to you yet because it's impregnated with too much anomalous energy and it can be dangerous for a mere human. As soon as I get the "light", we will go immediately to Zakharych and there I'll tell you something very useful.
Okay.
Do you have it?
Yes, I have the artifact. Now we'll go to the Hunter.
Let's go.
Well, can I have it?

Yes, meanwhile I will stay here, Zakharych knows me. The truth is, he's a little afraid. Take the artifact, it seems to have cooled down. Now you can safely enter the "Death Zone," but I advise you not to stay there too long.
Thank you, Black Stalker!
Just call me Dick.
Well, Dick. So, what did you want to tell me?
It concerns the purpose of your quest... Have you thought about what happens if you find the Klondike?
I'm not yet sure whether it really exists, maybe it's just a legend. Tell me, is the Klondike a reality?

Follow your intuition stalker, because you can trust it. All I can tell you about the Klondike, it's just that at the end of your journey you'll have to wage a deadly battle with one of the creatures of the Zone.
And who will win?
This is something I don't know. Good luck to you.
What on earth are you looking for? Did you lose something?
I haven't lost anything. I'm just looking. It's been almost a week! These spirits, they keep hovering around me...
I don't understand! I'll ask again: are you crazy?

Man, just don't think I'm crazy, or as drunk as a skunk! I'm not! In this house there is some kind of hell happening. I settled here recently, Wolf told me I could. He said it was the only free house in the village... Yeah, I can see why nobody wanted to live here, the place is terrible!
What is wrong then?

Something invisible comes through here at night. The first night I slept here I heard it: loud stomping and moans, and sometimes I could even make out some words. They stomp through the house, moaning and then they begin to quietly sneak up on me; they are barely audible except for the creaking floorboards. If you lay down and don't move, you can hear the breathing become harder... It starts to choke you!
Wow! What is it? A Controller perhaps, or what?
No this is not exactly a Controller. This is something much worse! I'm afraid that I can't stay here any longer, and must get the hell out of here...
But you didn't answer my question: What are you looking for?

Ah, yes! I forgot. I began asking the lads around here. Well, one told me a story. True or not, I don't know, but it seems that before the Chernobyl accident, the owner of this house was brutally murdered. They say blood was found everywhere, even in the yard, but the body was never found. Or rather, they found part of it; the murderer dismembered the corpse and hid the pieces in different places: in the house, in the yard and even the immediate vicinity. It seems that the spirit of the dead man cannot rest. Of course, I didn't believe it at first, but when this mess started in the night, I thought: "Perhaps it's the truth?". So I searched the house... Imagine this! I found a strange bone under one of the floor boards. I showed it to the doctor, and he said it was human. I don't know what to think right now!
Let me look, maybe I can find something else.
It doesn't make sense...
Listen, I've found some bones...
Where?
In various places in the yard. A skull, wrist, shin...
Wow! Come on, let me see!
Here you are.
What was it?
How do I know? A spirit? No, most likely a poltergeist. Although... No, it was just a poltergeist, right?
You're asking me? After all, it's your house.
Look, I don't think it matters now. I'll bury the remains you found; here at the edge of the village is a small cemetery. It seems that I'll sleep much calmer now. Here, take this as a thank you.
Well, so be it.
What are you doing here, tramp? If I was you, I'd get out of here as soon as possible.
I need to clean up some affairs...
What the hell? Speak up.
You are holding a scientist, doctor Gorbovsky. Some of your men took him a few days ago. I've come for him.
That old man... He's been nothing but trouble. It seems to me that his colleagues are not going to pay the ransom, and have sent you here to beg for his release, am I right?
The scientists are in serious financial trouble, and the situation threatens a serious scandal at the international level.
I'm not going to beg. Tell me where the scientist is, or get a bullet between the eyes!
Ha-ha, you make me laugh! And what country will impose an ultimatum? In my detachment, I have guys from four countries, will they declare war on all four of them?
What do you want for him? Other than the money you have already asked for.
Have you been in the Zone for a long time?
Not really, but it's not exactly my first day.
Have you dealt with the military?
I've had some skirmishes with them, we don't exactly see eye to eye. Why?
The fact is, you can help us now right now. If you work for me, and all goes well, you'll get your four-eyed professor back. That way, nobody will have to pay.
What should I do?

Well, then, let me explain the situation: we're not sitting here on our bum for the fun of it. We have a contract to capture an army officer, who's serving here in the Zone. According to the agreement, he must be taken alive and very quickly as he is very urgently needed by some people. We know that he will be driving past soon in a van, with three military bodyguards. It's necessary to stop the van, eliminate the guards and grab the officer alive and unharmed if possible. All clear?
How do you plan to stop him?

My guys have laid dynamite on the road. When the van with the colonel is near us, you will have to detonate the charge so that explosion doesn't damage the car, but compels the driver to pull up by the roadside, and then we will give you smoke cover. I'll give you a signal when to detonate the dynamite. Remember, we need the Colonel alive!
Everything is clear, we can proceed.

Well, here's the detonator. The charge is beside the rusty cars on the road. I would advise you to keep a low profile and to detonate it from right here, in this barn. You can watch the road through the window. The van should appear at any moment, from the east.
Good.
You mother fucker, what do you think you're doing? Do you know who I am and what could happen to you?
Shut your mouth and put your hands behind your head! Quickly move to that barn and sit there quietly!
Who wants me so urgently?

Close friends from abroad, who else. And you, you degenerate, will soon end up there. And when you get there, it will be long, painful and terrible, believe me. I will make sure of it! Your friends got off easy.
"Here, sign for it!" Now I want to know where the doctor is located.

Well done, stalker! I would gladly take you into our "guerrilla" group, ha-ha! Now I will send a message to the men guarding the scientist, they will return him to the place from which he was kidnapped, in one piece hopefully.
You suggest I take your word for it?

Did you think I would give you the location of this unit? Don't worry, those who knows me, also know: Denard's word is law! So quietly go back to the Bar and pick up this doctor. Pray that nothing eats him while he waits for you beside the road, ha-ha-ha!
You're a comedian, Denard.
I know... Yeah, one more thing: here's a bonus as a reward from me: artifacts, or whatever you call them there. My boys, God bless them, collected a few while we waited for the Colonel:
Thank you, I have to go.
The BTR is destroyed, but the Colonel has escaped. Now what?

It's a failure! Stalker, you screwed an operation that we spent over a year preparing which cost a lot of money! What will I tell the customer now? Really, was it that hard to push the button in time? It was that simple!.. I'll tell you what: if you leave very quickly, you may live a little longer, or maybe not!
There are disappointments in life. Will you still release the scientist?
If I release him, it will be into the jaws of the local fauna! He can sit with us until somebody pays, okay? This conversation is over.
Yes, there are disappointments in life...
Unfortunately, the Colonel was killed. Now what?

It is a failure! Stalker, you screwed an operation that we spent over a year preparing which cost a lot of money! What will I tell the customer now? Really, was it that hard to take him alive?.. I'll tell you what: if you leave very quickly, you may live a little longer, or maybe not!
There are disappointments in life. Will you still release the scientist?
If I release him, it will be into the jaws of the local fauna! He can sit with us until somebody pays, okay? This conversation is over.
Yes, there are disappointments in life...
Well, is it done?
Wait a moment, apparently, it's not over yet. It's necessary to wait a bit to ensure that no one is coming to his aid.
Sidorovich, I have something to discuss... (talk about the deserter)

So he is a soldier? It would have been better if you brought me some cans, I swear! He-he! However, I don't stick my nose in the affairs of others, you know.\nLet him stay in the camp. If he is a responsible guy, the lads will accept him and he will accustom quickly. I'll talk with locals about him, we will look after the guy. Don't worry, no one will ridicule him. We will find a use for him, you've done all you can for him. Well, we'll see how he turns out.\nSo tell him.
Who are you? Say goodbye to your life!
Don't shoot.
Let me pass.
Do you have a smoke?
Here, take it.
Nope.
So look for some, and then I'll have a short absence from my post and have a cigarette. Then you can go in.
What happened to you?
Water... I beg you for some water!
Here, drink.
Nope.
Please tell my brothers that I did not have time to warn them... Report!.. I've been here five days...
Where are your brothers?

They are here at the Darkscape, in a secret bunker... As you go North from the forester's hut, you'll see a boulder, and there, behind the bushes, is the entrance to the tunnel... The door code is 1983... I've had it, I can't go on any more.
Wait! How do I remove the anomaly?
Safe ... open the safe! Code... I don't remember... some numbers... something at this gas station... columns!
Wait, I'll help you!
Who are you and how did you get here?
I'm called Marked One. I went by the refuelling station and found one of your guys there, he needs to be rescued urgently.
Who did you find, what happened to him?
There were two men, one named Jeka, he's still alive. The second one died, they fell into a spatial trap and have been there without food or water for five days.
Can you prove what you're saying? This is serious, I can't just send my men anywhere.
Jeka gave me the door code. Plus I have a fragment of the artifact, which formed the spatial trap at the refuelling station.
That will do. We need to rescue him urgently, is he still there?
Yes, at the gas station, but... Hey, actually who are you? And what is this place?

This is an old German bunker the saboteurs used during the war. I will tell you more later if you help us. Time is short. I want the doctor to go with you to our brother's aid, and Tokarev, who is our gunsmith, will act as your guard. Take them back with you and cover them. We will be in your debt and then I'll tell you who we are. That is, if you're still interested.
Okay, I'm ready.
Then go to Korneev, and move out. Take him and Tokarev to the victim.
I got it.
Arkady told us to move out. Are you ready? I'll cover you.
I'm ready, I just need to collect my bag with medicines... It will only take a couple of minutes.
Okay, but we need to hurry - your brother won't last long.
Yes, of course. Tokarev and I will meet you at the entrance in a few minutes.
Agreed.
We're getting close. Are you ready?
Yes. It can be dangerous here, we need to be careful.
That goes without saying.
What are you doing, wandering around here? You're interfering with our operation!
What operation?
The "Duty" group's operation to apprehend offenders.
What did they do?
Those two are members of a criminal organization which is engaged in theft of artifacts and the looting of stalkers. They ransack caches, steal the loot, and then sell it. Is that clear?
What are you going to do?
Arrest them. Look, whatever your name is... well, never mind. Tell those buttheads that they are caught, to lay down their arms and surrender. They have five minutes.
I'll tell them.
Listen mate, you and your "Duty" group can piss off!. You fucking cops are crazy.
They are from Duty and they have come for you.
Oh no, we've had it! We need to do something... We must get out of this trap somehow!
Listen, this Duty guy says that you and your friends in the bunker are stealing artifacts. What the hell's going on here? I demand an explanation.

So be it, circumstances require me to tell you the truth. Look, we and the rest who you saw in the bunker are members of a secret brotherhood called "Cleaners". What we are engaged in, is not theft at all, we clear the Zone of artifacts and, respectively, we save the outside world.
In my opinion, this is why Duty got involved.

They destroy the consequences, and we are fighting the causes. It is because of those people who came here for these creations that there is so much evil in the Zone. All members of our brotherhood have a personal account to settle with the Zone. For example, I lost my wife to the Zone, Tokarev - a brother, and our leader Arkady - a son... We don't steal artifacts, you must understand. We collect them by all suitable means and destroy them.
I'm sorry, Did I hear you correctly? You said "destroy"?
Quite so. This is our revenge on the Zone and our method of controlling the cause of the anger generated by greed for artifacts and money.
At this pace, can you achieve significant results? You appear to be a small group.

Yes, we have a total of nine, but we have agents in almost all parts of the Zone and among all the factions, even in the "Monolith". They try to intercept large consignments of artifacts and to redirect them to the Darkscape, also reconnoitre places of group caches and warehouses, also block deliveries from dealers.
So that's why "Duty" is so mad at you. They don't want you to touch the artifacts so they can pass them on to the scientists.

I am a scientist myself and I can tell you that to do research requires a much smaller number of artifacts than the management of "Duty" gets every month from his quads. Marked One, we don't want to harm anyone, understand. We destroy evil in its tracks. Help us! Don't let these executioners capture us, no one should know the location of the bunker, otherwise our brotherhood will end!
What can we do?
I need to hit the road.
I propose to use the power of the artifact.
What do you mean?
Our brother Jeka came around a few minutes ago and told me that you managed to defuse some anomalous trap that was here before. Is that true?
Actually, yes. It was something like a spatial anomaly.

This phenomenon is known to us. It is generated by the 'Pendulum' artifact. If you intend to keep it for a long period of time, it shouldn't come in contact with a living body. Because it made him feel uncomfortable, our brother kept it in the safe forgetting the code - all this you know. But the point is this: This unique artifact has a very interesting feature - it can teleport objects over short distances. For this purpose it is necessary to combine it with an artifact generating electrical energy. When the artifact discharges, the "Pendulum" will absorb the energy and will make a spatial jump, dragging its carrier with it. Understand what I'm saying?
I got it. But there is one problem. During the destruction of the spatial trap, the artifact shattered into pieces.

Don't be surprised, this is its feature. It very often breaks up into some fragments but after a while, having received an impulse, it grows back together and becomes whole. How many pieces of the "Pendulum" do you have?
I had four, but I gave the largest piece to your leader.

This is destiny! The circumstances could not be better. See: we can use the pieces of the "Pendulum" to transfer to the bunker because when they absorb the electrical impulse, smaller pieces will be attracted to the larger one and each of them will entrain its owner. But there's a problem...
Yes. There're four of us, but we only have three pieces.
Something to offer? I have run out ideas.
You, Jeka and Tokarev teleport to the bunker, and somehow I will find a way out of here.
It's necessary to leave the injured here, he's a goner anyway.
To hell with Tokarev, we need to save our skins.
Listen, that's very generous of you! If you haven't change your mind, then give me the pieces of the "Pendulum" and we'll leave right now.
It's a pity... He's our best agent. Well, nothing can be done, we'll have to leave him here.
You're despicable... It would have been more desirable if he lived, now Duty will capture and execute him. Let me help Jeka and you prepare the pieces.
Until we meet again. Here are the pieces. Good luck, Cleaners!
Okay, here are the pieces of the artifact, give me your "Sparkler"...
No time for pity, bring on the impulse, here are the pieces...
What will we do? No one wants to be captured by Duty.
Hell, it's not funny.
Should we try to fight back?

I'd love to, but the forces are not equal... All I took with me was a this weapon. It will frighten boars away, but against machine guns, it's a weak argument. Listen, speak with Korneev, he may come up with something.
Okay.
Your brother is alive and relatively healthy.
I'm impressed by how you skilfully used the Zone's power to help us. Now you're one of our brotherhood. If you have a personal score to settle with the Zone, you can join our ranks.
No, thank God, no.
I'm sorry to hear that you don't want to join us. However, I will not let leave without a reward. What can I give you?
What about some artifacts?
Ammo, equipment, weapons...
Well, at the moment, I'm pressed for money.
I don't need anything.
Sorry, but with all due respect, I can't give you artifacts because they are evil, and we don't share them, we destroy them.
Here, take it:
Here, take it:
Here, take it:
How could I forget.
Thank you.
Oh, thanks.
Thank you.
Unfortunately, we were unable to save the agent.
Unable or unwilling? However, it doesn't matter. I don't think you will be welcome here. The sooner you go, the better. Bye.
Wait a minute... But there was a whole Duty squad!
This stalker was a friend of my dead son. Now the Zone has taken him as well - the only man who reminded me of my Andrew. I don't want to listen to you, go away.
Okay.
Your scout is saved.
Very good. But where is Tokarev?
He remained behind to cover our retreat.
Damn this Zone, he was a good stalker. I don't know what to say now to Kalash...
Who is he?
Tokarev was his brother... However, he must stay strong, otherwise he won't survive.
Yeah, it ended very badly.
Hello stalker. Got a minute?
Hey. Who are you?
I'm Vasya Schukin, my brother Petya and I recently arrived in the Zone. We don't want to wander too far from the camp, until we gain some experience. But we need help.
I'm listening.
Not now.

Yesterday, we explored the neighbourhood and found something interesting. We want to examine this thing better and we need someone who will cover us. If you help us with this sortie, then if we find anything valuable, we'll share it with you. Okay?
And what kind of thing did you find?
It's a secret... What about it?
Okay, let's go.
Wait.
Are we there?

You could say that. See this fridge? There is something hidden in it and I want to see what it is. Yesterday, my brother and I couldn't open it, but today I brought some pliers. Perhaps there is something of value inside...
Hmm, interesting. Well, search it and I'll cover you.
Ha-ha, that's an outstanding feature! That cracked me up! Bless him!
Was that your doing?

Ha-ha. Yesterday I was behind these suckers watching them trying to open the cache, but they couldn't. Then I decided to play trick and put a grenade in the fridge. So, well, you know, it's there, and it blew the guys face off! Ha-ha-ha!
Do you even know what you've done? You've killed a newcomer.
Well, to hell with him. Do you want to cry over him? Or maybe you're gay? Or something like that...
You're bothering me!

Well-well, he won't make that mistake again. I advise you not to mess with me. Do you know why? If you denounce me, you will have to deal with Kulgavy. He will send his gladiators and they will massacre all in the village, together with Wolf and Stalin, it's like duck soup for them because all of them are masters.
Who is Kulgavy?
A very influential person. Ask Wolf, he will tell you. All clear?
See you later.
Get lost buster!
That's funny! He was a louse, and now he's dead!
Uh-huh... Hey, why don't you finish off the other one? Just for fun. There won't be any witnesses.
Hmm...
Don't be a pussy. Finish him off, and I'll tell you something interesting.
Alright, hold on.
Okay, he's dealt with.

Funny, dude, funny, funny! You did a great job with him. You'd have to put the carcasses in the fridge, nobody will find them there for a long time... Hey, would you like to work for my boss? He needs people now.
Who is he?

Kulgavy. He recently had a falling out with the other leaders, so he took his most loyal guys, formed his own band, and is now laying low. He sits quietly, but he keeps his ears open! I was sent here to get info for him and what not.
How can I find him?
He's in Darkscape, at the small village close to the road to Dark Valley. Show respect, and you won't be harmed.
Got it, thanks for the info.
Okay, fuck him.

I fucking told you to keep it quiet and use a knife! If stalkers find their corpses, they'll ask me a lot of questions and I'm going to have to fuck off. Okay, I'll shove these suckers into the fridge so that nobody will find them. But you should come see the godfather in Darkscape.
I'll check it out.
Are you okay?
He... He... killed Vasya! My brother!
Calm down, tears of sorrow won't help. It's better to decide what to do next.
I don't know if I can keep from killing this motherfucker... It's hard to think about it. The Zone, is a bastard! Why did we come here?
Come on, be a man. Now you have to be careful. I would put a bullet in this freak's head, but this may affect other people. We'll wait for a more convenient opportunity.
Yes I know... I will learn to survive and who to trust.
How can I help you?
Please, do me one last favour. Take me to the house where my brother lived. It's nearby. I have a bad feelings about this...
Okay.
You will remain here?
Wait...
What is it?
I think the gunman planned to kill me. Sit here for a little bit in case he comes back.
Okay.
Have you got business with this newbie?
Yes, I kicked his ass, and he took off and ran.
Why did you kill him?
He pushed me around.
How are you?
I've been better...
Did he hurt you badly?
I don't know, I can't feel my hands or face... My bones seem to be intact.
The swelling will pass, you'll live. I see you really can't stand up for yourself. You've got a weapon!
I could not kill this monster... his friends would have killed me... Now they will take revenge.
I think he lied through his "teeth".

Listen, I can't thank you enough. I don't have anything other than this old gun and a can of food, but I don't think it would be much help to you. Here's what: when my late brother and I went to the ATP, we saw a tunnel entrance at the end of some railroad tracks. Inside the tunnel, something shone and shimmered, it was similar to an artifact. It was at night and we weren't able to inspect the tunnel because there were a lot of dogs about and we had bad weapons. Look there, and if it's something really valuable, then it is yours.
I'll go and look.
Hi brother. I have a message from Borov.
From whom?
Don't you know Borov? He's the big boss.
I know he's the big boss, but why the hell would he send us a message all of a sudden? We're on Friar's payroll, he is in charge of us. He's Borov's right-hand man.
I know, I know... Friar is busy, so he sent me. Anyway, I've got a message.
Give it to me.
Here you go.
So... What the hell... Who the hell is this from, I don't understand?
What's the problem?

Don't you dare tell me that Borov wrote it. What the hell is this crap: "wankers", "I'll poke your eye's out", "I'll get nasty"? What the hell is with all the mistakes? Borov is well educated, proud of it, and his men respect him for it...! Listen, this belongs in the trash, doesn't it?
Why are you making such a big deal out of this? If you're trying to act like a big shot Borov will shoot you in the head himself!
Okay, I'll tell it like it is...
Come on, but make it quick. By the way: who are you? Our messages are always delivered by Nosey, and now you decide to come here in here and bring me this note??
I'm actually a stalker, not a bandit. Don't be in a hurry to shoot: I come in peace! Why spill blood unnecessarily? It is better to negotiate.
Indeed, why not? Let's talk.
Look: you release the prisoner, and I go to the stalkers who are sitting ready to ambush you (there are ten of them) and convince them not to attack you. How's that?
Ten you say? Wow ... And where are they hiding?
In the bushes, fifty metres to the south of the here.
Look, you're right... Let's do it, I value my boys, you care about yours. Besides, the guys are kind of outnumbered. Now I'll give the signal to let the prisoner go, and you go and talk to yours.
Great, I knew you were the reasonable man!
A reasonable man? Um... Hey, I almost forgot. What's that thing sticking out of your pocket?
Where?
Friar wrote a transfer order for the prisoner, and asked me to deliver it on his behalf.
Why is that?
Recently he scored big time, so he's decided to lay low for a while because he doesn't want to attract attention.

Probably lost at cards again, playing with the brothers. Ha-ha, now he won't be yapping about his good luck. Okay, forget what I said, just give me the note and take your fucking loser and get the hell out of here.
All right, I got it.
I managed to trick the bandits and rescue Nimble.
Great! I feel like screaming "Now Hunchback! I said Hunchback!"
It's better to learn how to write a bandit's note properly.
Fuck it, I give up, I'm no Sharapov.
You did well... Okay, let's get out of here.
Yes, it makes no sense to stay here.
See you later.
I'm sorry, but Nimble and your scouts were killed.
It's because of you! Petruha managed to radio me and report you wanted to deceive the bandits. If you didn't have the stomach for a fight, why did you put my people at risk?
I wanted the best outcome.
You're a fool, though you seem experienced! When you deal with the bandits, you can't tell them too much because they can't be trusted.
Next time I'll let my weapon do the talking.
I'm sorry, but Nimble was killed.
It's because of you! Petruha managed to radio me and report you wanted to deceive the bandits. If you didn't have the stomach for a fight, why did you risk his life?
I wanted the best outcome.
Okay, a war is not without casualties... Here, take this money, because you fought the bandits.
Thank you.
I've returned.
Why, what happened?
Those bastards made me.
Damn! How did that happen, huh?
This is how! They appeared to be nervous. By the way, your transfer note didn't fool them.
I'll take that into account in the future. I'm sorry about Nimble, of course, but what can we do! The bandits are bitches.
Yeah...
Nimble was killed. I did everything I could.
I'm sorry about Nimble, of course, but what can we do! The bandits are bitches.
How's life in general?
Fine. Recently, I bought myself a new shooter.
A necessary item to have.
And then some! Especially for someone like me. Here, look: this is a customized Kalashnikov PKM machine gun.
Impressive, but why do you need such a thing if you're just a digger?

Instrument... What do you know about guns? See: here's a new 6T5 Stepanov machine gun tripod, special straps for securing magazines with ammunition belts, brackets on the legs of the machine gun for attaching magazines for use in combat situations, it has the ability to be used for anti-aircraft fire, in addition, it's also considerably lighter than the previous models!
Yes, I see that you really love guns. But why are you hiding it and not keeping it at the ready?
You see, a calamity happened recently: I handed over my gun to a local amateur gunsmith for an additional upgrade, well, he...
... broke it? That's sad.
Yeah. By the way, do you want to earn some money? If you help me and take it to get repaired, I'll tell you a secret.
What secret? Something about the design of the locking mechanism? It would be cheaper to read a book about it.
No, something much more interesting: I'll tell you about a very strange anomaly, which I found in a cave. One I have never seen before.
Tempting... Okay, I agree. Where do you want me to take your weapon?
I'm busy at the moment.

Look: when you get to the Bar, go to the building where the Arena is located. To the right of the entrance, sitting alone in a small room, you'll find a stalker, who definitely will be drunk. If he's asleep, then wake him up and hand him the gun. Tell him if he doesn't fix it, he'll get no more from me. Got it?
Understood.
Greetings, mate. I here from Yuri the Digger, on account of his custom shooter.
Mm-m... What-oh?
I'm from the Digger. He brought you his gun for repairs but you fucked it up. It won't even shoot anymore, so fix it.
Who...what Digger? What gun? Where in general am I? What day is it?
You should drink less! You're at the Bar. Get your head together and correct this work on the digger's gun.
I'm not... hic... in good shape right now. I need another drink, otherwise I'll die. Pour me one, huh?
Have a drink.
No "pouring"! Just fix the gun, I don't intend to wait until you sober up.
Why are you people are so evil... You should be good guys... Okay, give me the gun.
Take it:
How's it going?
It's done. Forgot to put a spring in the last time, everything will be fine now.
I'll take the weapon back to its owner.
I found Bruise at the Bar and forced him to repair your machine gun.
Well done! Come on, let me look at my baby...
Receive and pay:
So, let me try it out... Hmm... Something is not right.. What is this nonsense? Strange.
What's the matter?

Shoddy work, that's what. What did that butt-head fix? The breach - it looks like he took to it with a sledgehammer. The paint on the magazine is scratched and the trigger mechanism seems shattered. No, it's not a good job, it's garbage. I once saw how Freedom at the Military Warehouses repair weapons. I'll tell you what, it was a feast for your eyes. That person had imagination! This... won't do.
What now?

What do you mean? Naturally it needs to be repaired, immediately. I can't travel through the Zone with just a pistol! Take this trash and carry it back to Bruise. Tell him everything wasn't fine, okay?
I'll tell him.
Come on, it's time to take responsibility for what you did.
Comrade Sergeant, I'm not guilty, I didn't do it!.. Oh, it's you again.
Yuri has ordered that you finish the work. It's still fucked, even more than before perhaps. Here, fix it.
I've had enough of you and Yuri. Okay, hand the gun here.
Here you go, repair it so I don't have to come back again.
Is it ready?
It's ready, you bastard! I forgot to tighten a couple of small screws the last time, that was the problem.
Well, great then.
Bruise corrected his work, take your damn gun:
Wait, wait! Let me take a look. Yeah ... Yeah ... Hmm. And what's this? How is it possible to make such gross blunders? This angers me!
It's not right, again?

Of course not! Look at the coating over the barrel: It's hopelessly scratched and starting to rust. And the nozzle on the gas tube is loose, and when I start shooting, I guess it will just fly off. Verdict: this weapon is unusable!
What can I advise you. Look for another repairman.
Uh-uh, no, Bruise will repair everything for me! He's done such good work for me at other times, besides, he promised. So take the gun back to him, you know what to do.
Well, damn you, I'll take it back to your amateur gunsmith!
Hey, alcoholic! Get up, more work to do.
I have the day off.
No, you have to finish what you started.
What, the gun broke down again?
It never worked. Fix this piece of rubbish, it's your last chance.
There is no rest for the weary. Give me that piece of iron.
Take it and remember that my patience, too, has limits.
Everything fixed?

Yes. I went through everything, I checked and tightened all the screws and lubricated it. The receiver works like a charm, the trigger is the same. You must understand, I would have checked it out before, but you cannot shoot here.
Any spare parts accidentally left over?
That offends me!
Then it's time to drag this "masterpiece" back to its owner.
Well, now your gun is finally ready. Take it!
Ready, you say? He-he... No, I've been around too long, I'm not easily fooled. Let me look at it through a master's eyes... So... \n~ a long silence ~
Well?
Marked One, I don't understand...
What?
Are you and Bruise, trying to scam me?
Don't say that...
Well, this thing's not working! What else is new?
I cannot stand another trip to the Bar humping this instrument of contention.
Marked One, you want to know the secret of the unknown anomaly? It's worth it.
I would like to, so I'll take your gun this last time!
It's me again.
Again? How many times do I have to see you?
Bruise, if you fix this damn gun correctly both of us will be better off.
I'll fix it again only to prevent him from accidentally shooting himself. Give it to me.
Here.
Is that it? I don't even want to hear about what you forgot to do last time.
Okay... I won't. Take the damn gun, I'm tired of looking at it...
Listen... Maybe we should take it to Barkeep or to Sidorovich. We could both chip in a little for repairs.

It's not that simple: They both hesitated for a long time to do it, so I was the only one who agreed to repair it. You know, this model is trash, it was never issued. All the parts come from different models, some of which should have been bulldozed into the ground, plus a bunch of unnecessary bells and whistles. I'm not sure if it even ever worked.
There is no escape, you have to drag it back.
Here's your gun. Bruise said that it's now in 100 percent working order.
I trust no one, I'll check!
Don't you believe me?
You, I believe, but Bruise, no. Let me see, so... nope! What the fuck is that rattling around in there? I wouldn't dare shoot this thing.
You've got to be kidding me.
I'm starting to wonder, is this his blunder or yours? Or perhaps both?
Fuck off, I'm doing all the legwork here so save your bitching for someone else.

How is it that you don't care? When I got this thing it barely worked. As far as I could tell, this gun was never combat ready: I'm telling you this for the last time, the receiver was hanging and the recoil spring was missing. Yes, apparently, I'm talking to deaf ears. Marked One, it's time to get your feet moving again!
Why are you telling me this?
I say that this indecency should be corrected. You know what to do.
I know.
Look, why don't you...?

Ah well? Okay. I hope you won't be surprised when the traders won't buy artifacts from you? The scientists are too far away to go there... I can take care of this because I have known Sidorovich, Barkeep and Miser for a long time. This is your last chance.
Don't try to pull the wool over my eyes.
Sorry, I got excited... I'll take the gun to Bruise.
Guess what I brought you again.
What now? It's not funny any more.
I know. We need to do something.
I tell you what: just tell the digger that you lost the gun, and that's that..
It's not an option. He cherishes this piece of junk and would not forgive me. I wanted to refuse this bad job, but he threatened he would stain my reputation with the traders.
He can... We must be more cunning. Let's get him a new gun, and then we can throw out this piece of shit. I will try to make it look similar, and you tell him it has undergone a serious renovation.
Damn it, come on. I've had enough of this Yuri the Digger. This gun is special to him, he'll pick the substitute.
Bullshit, I'll do it so he won't be able to tell the difference.
You can get this gun?
There's one available...
How will you get it? You spend everything on vodka, but I can see it in your face that you have a plan.

A Duty friend has one, he obtained it a long time ago. No problem, I'll figure something out. As a last resort, I'll party with him and get him so drunk, he'll give it to me and not remember anything in the morning.
Well look. This is our last chance.
How's it going?
Everything is okay. The nerd won't be able to tell the new gun from the old one, even under a microscope.
I hope so, otherwise my reputation as an artifact hunter will be tarnished.
Hello, Strelok. I see you managed to cheat the Zone.
It was you and I who were cheated, Doctor. How are you?
Oh... I decided to retire.
Done with being a stalker? But why?
Because Strelok, there are more important things in life.
I won't disagree. So, are you leaving the Zone?
No. Now my calling is to help those who are in need.
Who will you help?
I will treat people and mutants.
Mutants? Why?
Well, they are living beings as well... Strelok, I'll explain everything later, alright?
Okay.
Perhaps, you need some help with your work?
Yes. I need help with treating.
Sounds good.
Just be careful, because we'll treat bloodsucker.
With bullets, I hope?

Think before you say, Strelok! Listen to what I have to say. There's this unique bloodsucker, I've been watching him from the roof of this house. So, he is unwell for some reason. It is necessary to examine the beast, but you understand it won't hurt to take safety precautions.
Do you want to catch him alive?

Exactly. It's necessary to shoot it with a tranquilliser dart from my special pistol, then drag it back here. Only it should be done quickly, before it can wake up. The tranquillising effect will last for about three minutes, but that should be enough time. Well, can I count on you?
Let's try.
I'll pass.

Well then, remember: you're not allowed to approach the mutant closer than 15 metres, otherwise it will smell you, even through the reeds. Be careful, use the optical sight and choose a comfortable position. If you scare away the mutant, you will then have to chase it around the Marsh, and I don't have any more special arrows. And don't try to shoot the bloodsucker with firearms! I won't forgive you if you do.
Thank you for the warning.
Take your "sufferer"!
Well, thank you, Strelok, now he's safe!
When you begin the treatment it could wake up and attack.
Do you think I had not foreseen such a possibility? Don't worry, I have my own methods of influence on mutants.
Well, you're a real Doctor Doolittle!
Well, aren't you the joker! Okay, it was a dangerous assignment, so accept this humble present from me:
Thank you!
No, I do not take gifts from you, you saved my life.
As it turned out, I had to euthanise your bloodsucker.
Right, because you had to go, like a bull at a gate! I would be scared, too.
It's not my fault that he was so sensitive.
Therefore Strelok, it's necessary to be more cunning. You should have climbed up a tree and shot him with the dart from there, as he dashed past.
Have you surrendered to the Zone? Every day, stalkers are shooting mutants, struggling for survival in the Zone; why did you suddenly decide to treat them?
The answer is not so simple. I'll tell you later why I made this decision, but for now, rest.
What's up, Doctor?
Trouble, Strelok. There's an old pseudo-dog who lives here in the neighbourhood, that's unwell. It's necessary to treat it.
Like your little bloodsucker?
What do you mean "little"? What's that got to do with it? I ask for your help.
Do I need to tranquillise it and drag it here too?
As soon as possible.
Okay, I'll try.
No.

Well, then listen. You already have my special pistol, here's some more tranquilliser darts. Though the pseudo-dog is sick, it can still pick up your scent, therefore don't get any closer to it than 20 metres, because you will frighten it away! When you tranquillise him, quickly drag him back, before he wakes up.
Understood.
I brought the pseudo-dog. It seems it's still breathing.
Good for you, Strelok! I'll start treatment, and you deserve a good reward. Take this in all sincerity:
It'd be an honour!
