No, Doctor. I won't take anything from you.
Don't be stubborn! I appreciate your attitude, but you risked your life. Take it, while I'm still offering.
You talked me into it.
Still no thanks.
There's a problem... basically, I accidentally killed the pseudo-dog.
Oh, Strelok! Well, so be it. It's a pity about Pirate - he served me faithfully for long ago.
It was your pet pseudo-dog?
Not just a pet, he was... more my friend. Something attacked him in the marsh and infected him with distemper, he ran away from me, crazed.
It's a pity.
You called me, Doctor, so here I am.
Well done. Let me tell you a story.
I've heard your stories before.
Of course, tell me. But I need to drink something first. I am dehydrated from running to you.
I get the hint! What do you prefer: local or imported?
Ah, a trick question. As far as I know you have imported vodka that is better than the local product.
I have a lot of things, but I don't advise you to find fault with the local product. Not all of it is of poor quality.
I'm persuaded. Let's have the local drop.
I shudder at the thought.
Yuck!
... So, Strelok. It's like this: while I was here at the Marsh I met a friend of mine. He told me a curious thing. You know where it is - the Dead City?
Near the Army Warehouses.
Correct. So he said that he saw something strange there.
Amazing.
In fact, he said that he met his former friend there, who died a year ago.
Hallucinations are rampant in the Zone.

Of course. But I believed him, even though he didn't understand it. What is interesting is this: his acquaintance asked him to give me a message, 'that soon something bad will happen to me'. What exactly, he did not say.
He told you that?
Yes. And that's why I'm telling you this.
Who is the stalker, who told you this?

A Loner, who had been in the Zone for two years. I treated him a few times for swamp fever, and of course examined him thoroughly. His mind was sharp and he wasn't a drug addict. You see, Strelok, I'm not a superstitious person, but all around us in the Zone new miracles happen every day, so you never know... Of course, I don't believe in messengers from the underworld, do you understand?
Do you take this message seriously?

There are many reasons to do so. Firstly, stalkers spread many rumours, one more absurd than the next, but some are true. Secondly, is that I'm not touched by mutants. And thirdly, of course, is my collection of artifacts.
Collection of artifacts?
Yes, the best and most complete in the Zone, and most likely, around the world... I can't tell you their value. Among them are several unique specimens.
Wow, Doctor! It's dangerous to possess such goods, especially when your alone.

Well, I already have some protection thanks to your efforts. The pseudo-dog and the bloodsucker will help, if need be. But after all, I'm not at home all the time, sometimes I go hiking on different affairs, often I call in at the Bar... Don't think I'm afraid, things are just different. I still have a lot to do in the Zone and I'm afraid that I don't have much time, so I can't stop. I beg you, deal with this case. Find out who this Stalker was, how he died, and why he appeared to my friend?
I'll try. but first, I have a couple of questions for you.
Don't fill your head with this silly nonsense, Doctor. No offence, I won't do it, I promise, no one will hurt you.
Of course, I'm listening.
To begin with: did you know that the deceased, who warned you?

Yes, I once helped him. It was no big deal: he was bitten by blind dogs and infected with rabies, his friends gave him aspirin at the start of the illness, but I took advantage of the opportunity to treat him, I happened to be at the Bar at the time. I saved his life, he was pleased and thanked me afterwards. He offered me money but I didn't take it. A year later I was told that someone at the Garbage had shot him. Whether it was bandits, or someone else, I don't know.
And the stalker, who allegedly saw him?
I already told you that I treated him for swamp fever which he picked up here. They call him Smoke, he's a Loner, who's been in the Zone for two years. I know nothing more about him.
Where can I find him?
He often appears here in the Marsh. He stays at the farm.
What does he do here?
Most likely looking for artifacts, what else. There, near the convoy of abandoned machinery you can sometimes find rare things.
And the last question: when is the last time he was there?
Why don't you ask him? Try it, why not. Only here's the deal: don't tell him that I told you where to find him. Understood?
Why the secrecy?

If this Smoke or someone else, has started something bad against me, they will say nothing to my envoy, that's you, and even worse, they will lie nineteen to the dozen. Tell him this: you were at the Doctor's, he was unwell and asked you to assist him in finding the ingredients for the medicine he needs to cook. Ask him where you can get the different chemicals, I'll draw up a list for the sake of appearances. Then try to find out something about the case.
Okay.

I'll watch the farm from the tower through binoculars. As soon as I notice someone there, I will send you the message at once. And you, please stay in the Marsh for a while. If you get bored waiting, you can perform a simple task for me.
I never refuse a task.

Good. I found myself an inflatable catamaran, but it's broken; it has no propeller. I don't want to order such an exotic thing from behind the perimeter, there are more important things. But you can try to get something similar to the propeller here. To the east of my house is a downed helicopter. If you tried to separate part of the screw from it, maybe, I could somehow adapt it for my needs.
I'll have a go.
Not today, Doctor. I am tired.
Then take a scientific suit and more antirads, because the place is contaminated:
Okay, then rest. And I will keep watch from the tower.
Hi, who are you, and what are you doing here?
I'm waiting to do some quest, but for now, I'm stuck here as a reminder.
You called?
Yes. In short, look here: you're a normal guy, right?
I'm normal.
If you are normal, you have to subdue simpletons. Let's do it together, join me and my brothers.
No one owes anyone anything.
Fuck it, let's do business. You want a lot of dough?
Are you inviting me to join you to rob a bank?
No, this is much easier. It's necessary to rub out a simpleton.
Cool, surely killing this simpleton, will pay a mountain of dough.
Yes or no?
Yes.
No.

Then listen up: soon this simpleton who needs to be terminated, will pass through the Garbage on his way to the Cordon. This is not just an ordinary simpleton, but Barkeep's "mule", loaded to his ears with a sizeable loot.
What's in it for me?
You'll get a quarter of what he carries.
That isn't enough.
Plus the respect of all our lads. If nothing else, Borov himself will offer you protection.
I understand that there are still some details to work out?

Yes. First, the "mule" will be guarded. Who and how many, fuck knows, but not a lot, because Barkeep will want to keep this campaign as low key as he can. Secondly, the "mule" will be equipped with a personal GPS beacon so Barkeep can keep track of his location. When the load reaches its destination, the "mule" is to send a signal to him that everything went well. If he doesn't then the Barkeep will enlist help from the Duty law enforcers and they will begin to scour the Cordon. We don't want this, so the work will need to be discreet: Once you have the loot, drag it here immediately.
I got it.
Halt, one - two!
Hello.
No "Hello" but "Good morning sir!"
Good morning sir!
We're not in the army, chill out, dude.
Report: what is your name and rank, where did you come from and where have you served? Make it snappy!
I don't remember, ever serving in the military...

So, you're a greenhorn! I'm a veteran, so far, I've spent a year in this shit hole, I know everyone, and everyone knows me. You'll pay me 300 roubles for each visit to Sidorovich, otherwise I won't let you into the bunker. Clear?
This is a shakedown.
Don't worry, everyone is a greenhorn at first, you'll become a veteran sooner or later. Until then, you can pay the dues.
Is this how you treat veterans? Attention!
I'll go. I have more important things to do like figuring out how to survive in this shit hole.
By the way, what's up with your gun?
This is my service rifle, greenhorn! Customized with modern technology to better serve me in The Zone. Prove yourself worthy and maybe one day I'll teach you about weapon upgrading.
Okay. Well, I gotta go. Goodbye.
Open the door, I need to see Sidorovich.
Where are my 300 roubles?
Here they are.
I don't have it.
I'll come back late.
This is not my first day of the Zone. If you don't want problems, just get out of the way.
Zakharych, look at this thing:
Where did you find it?
In one of your caches. What the heck is it?
So, let me see, I'm near sighted... Ah, this thing is useless. Throw it away.
Where did it come from? It's probably not garbage.

There was an incident a month ago. A star flew over the Darkscape, It flew from east to west, it was very low, even the trees bent and then, it crashed and shattered somewhere near the sawmill, throwing out purple sparks. That's the story, believe it or not.
Yes, it's interesting. A meteorite, probably.
Maybe a meteorite, maybe not.
What do you mean?
In my time, I've seen a few meteorites, but not many. I was not like any I'd seen before, this one was different.
Go on.
Oh, my memory, it's full of holes! I remember precisely that there was something interesting about this star, but I've forgotten what.
Well, sit and rest a little, you may remember.
No, if I was younger, I would have remembered, but I can't now. Look, humour an old man. Help me to assemble a moonshine still, then my soul will become cheerful, maybe I will help me remember.
A moonshine still? Where can I get one for you?

Let me think about it. Many of us oldies loved moonshine. It turns out that moonshine stills were set up where people lived, that is, near dwellings. Where were the most people in the Zone before the accident? That's right, in the cities. It's necessary to look for it in Pripyat, or in that town that is now called the "Dead City", I don't remember what it was named as earlier. Pripyat is too far away, so don't go there.
The moonshine stills would not only be in the Dead City, but in villages, and on farms surrounding it.
Could be there. But in the cities they were many set up, not just for local use, but also for sale. So, I would be easier looking for the device in the city.
But where? The town is small, but it would be like searching for a needle in a haystack.
I'll give you a hint. Search the basements and the attics of buildings. Moonshining was illegal so the stills were hidden in out-of-the-way places.
If I find one, I'll bring it.
Later.
I found something similar to a moonshine still. Look:
You sure did! It's bit primitive looking, but it should work Let's get it in here and I'll fire it up. It's been a long time since I had some home brew.
How did you know that I would find this device?
A good stalker such as you, will find what he's looking for! I'll brew some up, you can have the first taste.
Good luck making it. Listen, when will you finish telling me about these meteorite fragments? How they ended up in your caches, and why you collected them?
Marked One, I'll tell you everything, just wait until I'm done brewing. Okay?
Good.
What happened to me?
Well, what's up? You just punched my glove and nailed me on the couch for an hour. Why did you get so excited about it, maybe you were in a hurry and slept through it?
Whatever it is, it's got me covered. Some glitches went off.
Oh, my God, is that... So, the trick is exposed. Heh-heh.
I don't get it, I just... Come on, what did you put in my booze?!

Don't be mad, Marked One. Enjoy yourself. After all, we opened a new kind of moonshine with you. Its name is "Chernobyl Box". And I added a pinch of the same "stuff" that you were bringing me to my brother's drink. And not in vain, as you can see!
You deceiver!
Just calm down, I knew what I was doing. I'll give you one thing to comfort you... here, read it over. At the same time, you will reveal the mystery of the Zone again, hehe.
What's this? (Laughs) Not Carlos Castaneda, I hope?
No, a journalist wrote about me. Read it, remember it.
So, why do you charge for passage?
Well, I miss making dough from loot in the Cordon, so what? I give to live, while others live to give, understand?
Yes I understand.
Listen, smart guy, do you know what is my official salary?
I can guess.
Yeah, well you try and live on it here.
To live is not easy.
So, I'm supposed to feel a sense of fucking pride doing the government's dirty work for this pittance...
And how's that make you feel?
The commanders are getting fat, with all the profits they take out of the Zone! So why can't I do the same?
Good question.
What's my military duty? To obey orders and survive! So I survive as best I can!
That's one way of surviving.
Shit, can't those jerks see that this place is a fucking disaster? Any more of this, and I will either kill everyone, or shoot myself...
Definitely a disaster. Take care.
Why so sad? What were you thinking about?
Let me catch my breath. I'll take a rest and then I'll tell you.
Take care. Thank you, have a nice day.
The Zone is full of weirdos you don't want to meet.
That was funny.
Well I was amused.
An old stalker saying: Don't go forward without throwing bolts.
You must be drunk.
Well you know how to tell a good story.
I've heard this story before.
That's an old story.
Are you, military?
Let's open a bottle of vodka and I'll tell you a story about the Zone.
Why so serious? Can you tell me something cheerful?
I can't think of anything at the moment. When I do, I'll tell you.
Take care. Thank you, have fun.
Yes, damn it, it was cool.
It was funny.
Well, I was amused.
Yes, it was a funny anecdote.
A good anecdote. I'll remember that one.
Well, you know how to tell a good tale.
An old stalker saying: "Stay clean, if you're too lazy to scratch."
Good old black humour.
I'm still a bit hoarse from laughing.
Ah, the black humour.
You're so funny.
It's better not to come across such pranksters.
I heard something about this Lieutenant in the Zone.
Tell me something cheerful.
I can't think of anything just yet. When I remember, I'll tell you.
Well, it happens. Thank you, have a nice day.
Yes, damn it, it's cool.
It was amusing.
Well, I was amused.
Yes, a funny anecdote.
A good anecdote. I need to remember it.
Well, you know how to tell a good joke.
I haven't had a good laugh for a long time.
It serves him right.
I'm amused.
That tickled my ribs.
You made up this story.
That's funny.
That was delightfully funny.
You are painfully silent, can you tell me something funny?
I'll tell you later. Give me a break.
Okay. Have fun.
Yes, damn it, that was cool.
It was amusing.
That made me laugh.
Yes, it was a funny anecdote.
A good anecdote. I'll have to remember that one.
Well, you really know how to tell them.
It's been a while since I had a good belly laugh.
You told that well.
I'm amused.
That satisfied my appetite for humour.
That put me in high spirits.
That was funny.
Well, you're quite a storyteller.
Tell me something to uplift my mood.
Don't you have something else to do? I need a break.
Well, this was his home.
Interesting, are there such things as pseudo-fleas?
Never get involved with politics.
He doesn't sound too bright.
You can't fault his logic.
I feel down, can you tell me something cheerful?
Instead of baubles, they could have hung the balls of a pseudo giant.
Well, at least he made a profit.
Well, now I know where the bloodsuckers come from.
Sounds like a typical officer.
%c[100,50,250,80]Can we solve this a different way?%c[default]
Well, show me what you have.
All right. Yes, it seems closer. Well, now it's up to us!
Wait... Do you hear that?... Damn, this pack from the Garbage is still pursuing me. I'd be grateful if you'd help me shoot them.
Hello.
Did you get dragged out of the "death truck"? You don't look so bad.
Yes, I'm lucky, what can I say. Who are you anyway? You see, my brain is not so good, I don't remember the details.

I am a mercenary, I've been in the Zone nearly three years, I protect Sidorovich. A lot of people wanted to take advantage of him, so he employed me. He pays well and provides the grub, the work is not difficult, but it often gets stressful!
You say: you've been in the Zone for a while... Surely, you must have plenty of stories to tell.
Well, well, what happened next?
I'll be damned! That is certainly something to think about. Perhaps I may clear that up...
Well, you're a storyteller, do you think I believe you? Fucking liar! Piss off you coward, and never set foot in the Cordon again!
Well, you may get lucky. Goodbye and good luck!
Look, do you realise that I suddenly want to kill you?
Good luck to you too.
Okay, I was just kidding. Bye
Something bad is happening to me...
What's that?
Well, you know... Everything is blurry... And I have double vision... I'm all muddled up...
Aha! And different creature jump from under every bush? And you can't tell if they're real or not?
Exactly!
Heh! You arrived in the Zone yesterday.
That's the way it is.
Yes, it's all clear now.
Yes, very bad... I seems as if, I'm hearing voices... My head is ringing like a bell...
What do you usually do when this happens?
Well... with mutants. I shoot them and they just disappear. They don't fall... they don't die, they simply just disappear... they dissolve into the background...
Sometimes this happens. Either after an emission, or near a psi-zone. It's nothing, you'll get used to it. This is not the worst thing here.
Yes phantoms appear, they even pass through walls sometimes. Where do they come from?
No harm will come to you. You have a headache now brother. At such times, I try to think less and stop paying attention to what's happening around you.
And why "think less"?
First, because your head simply hurts, and secondly, they say that phantoms generate your thoughts. So, try to think less.
And why not pay attention?
It's necessary to stop paying attention in order to survive. Otherwise, the phantoms will reformat your brain so that you will become a zombie, and then you will die.
So it's... you know, that after an emission this crap happens. Listen, can you spare some vodka so we can survive this nightmare?
Why not, take it buddy, help yourself. Perhaps you will help me out sometime.
Sorry, mate. I don't have any vodka.
Well, thanks. I'll reciprocate. Take this canned food.
You're a good man. Take this gift from me.
Thank you friend.
Oh, thanks. Will you take this as a reward? Here you go, a "Medusa".
Oh, wow... You came to the rescue. I will never forget. Take this "Stone Flower" from me in gratitude.
And thank you.
It's my pleasure.
Dear fellow, I can see that you are good natured. Please, I need your help.
What do you want, aren't you the survivor from the death truck?
Oh, nothing. Just my luck, I'm out of vodka.
Yeah, the Blues came over me. Keep me company. I still have some vodka left.
Well, why not treat yourself. And I'm not averse to relaxing.
Thank you. But not to now.
Well, as you wish.
Help yourself.
You know, greenhorn, my grandfather lived to 106 years and nothing bothered him!
Was he eating stew with sausage and drinking vodka?
No, he didn't do what others were doing.
Get out of here.
Got it, I'm leaving.
Go to hell, you asshole.
Okay, I'm on my way.
Understood. Anything else?
Marked One, go to the dealer! He's calling for you.
I am on my way.
Well, you decided to do an ambush.
